2266  0xd70dd2eeL, 0x4e048354L, 0x3903b3c2L, 0xa7672661L, 0xd06016f7L,
2267  0x4969474dL, 0x3e6e77dbL, 0xaed16a4aL, 0xd9d65adcL, 0x40df0b66L,
2268  0x37d83bf0L, 0xa9bcae53L, 0xdebb9ec5L, 0x47b2cf7fL, 0x30b5ffe9L,
2269  0xbdbdf21cL, 0xcabac28aL, 0x53b39330L, 0x24b4a3a6L, 0xbad03605L,
2270  0xcdd70693L, 0x54de5729L, 0x23d967bfL, 0xb3667a2eL, 0xc4614ab8L,
2271  0x5d681b02L, 0x2a6f2b94L, 0xb40bbe37L, 0xc30c8ea1L, 0x5a05df1bL,
2272  0x2d02ef8dL
2273  };
2274 
2275  inline const uLong * get_crc_table() {
2276  return (const uLong *)crc_table;
2277  }
2278 
2279 #define CRC_DO1(buf) crc = crc_table[((int)crc ^ (*buf++)) & 0xff] ^ (crc >> 8);
2280 #define CRC_DO2(buf) CRC_DO1(buf); CRC_DO1(buf);
2281 #define CRC_DO4(buf) CRC_DO2(buf); CRC_DO2(buf);
2282 #define CRC_DO8(buf) CRC_DO4(buf); CRC_DO4(buf);
2283 
2284  inline uLong ucrc32(uLong crc, const Byte *buf, uInt len) {
2285  if (buf == Z_NULL) return 0L;
2286  crc = crc ^ 0xffffffffL;
2287  while (len >= 8) {
2288  CRC_DO8(buf); len -= 8;
2289  }
2290  if (len) do {
2291  CRC_DO1(buf);
2292  } while (--len);
2293  return crc ^ 0xffffffffL;
2294  }
2295 
2296 
2297 
2298  // =============================================================
2299  // some decryption routines
2300 #define CRC32(c, b) (crc_table[((int)(c)^(b))&0xff]^((c)>>8))
2301  inline void Uupdate_keys(unsigned long *keys, char c) {
2302  keys[0] = CRC32(keys[0], c);
2303  keys[1] += keys[0] & 0xFF;
2304  keys[1] = keys[1] * 134775813L + 1;
2305  keys[2] = CRC32(keys[2], keys[1] >> 24);
2306  }
2307  inline char Udecrypt_byte(unsigned long *keys) {
2308  unsigned temp = ((unsigned)keys[2] & 0xffff) | 2;
2309  return (char)(((temp * (temp ^ 1)) >> 8) & 0xff);
2310  }
2311  inline char zdecode(unsigned long *keys, char c) {
2312  c ^= Udecrypt_byte(keys);
2313  Uupdate_keys(keys, c);
2314  return c;
2315  }
2316 
2317 
2318 
2319  // adler32.c -- compute the Adler-32 checksum of a data stream
2320  // Copyright (C) 1995-1998 Mark Adler
2321  // For conditions of distribution and use, see copyright notice in zlib.h
2322 
2323  // @(#) $Id$
2324 
2325 
2326 #define BASE 65521L // largest prime smaller than 65536
2327 #define NMAX 5552
2328  // NMAX is the largest n such that 255n(n+1)/2 + (n+1)(BASE-1) <= 2^32-1
2329 
2330 #define AD_DO1(buf,i) {s1 += buf[i]; s2 += s1;}
2331 #define AD_DO2(buf,i) AD_DO1(buf,i); AD_DO1(buf,i+1);
2332 #define AD_DO4(buf,i) AD_DO2(buf,i); AD_DO2(buf,i+2);
2333 #define AD_DO8(buf,i) AD_DO4(buf,i); AD_DO4(buf,i+4);
2334 #define AD_DO16(buf) AD_DO8(buf,0); AD_DO8(buf,8);
2335 
2336  // =========================================================================
2337  inline uLong adler32(uLong adler, const Byte *buf, uInt len) {
2338  unsigned long s1 = adler & 0xffff;
2339  unsigned long s2 = (adler >> 16) & 0xffff;
2340  int k;
2341 
2342  if (buf == Z_NULL) return 1L;
2343 
2344  while (len > 0) {
2345  k = len < NMAX ? len : NMAX;
2346  len -= k;
2347  while (k >= 16) {
2348  AD_DO16(buf);
2349  buf += 16;
2350  k -= 16;
2351  }
2352  if (k != 0) do {
2353  s1 += *buf++;
2354  s2 += s1;
2355  } while (--k);
2356  s1 %= BASE;
2357  s2 %= BASE;
2358  }
2359  return (s2 << 16) | s1;
2360  }
2361 
2362 
2363 
2364  // zutil.c -- target dependent utility functions for the compression library
2365  // Copyright (C) 1995-1998 Jean-loup Gailly.
2366  // For conditions of distribution and use, see copyright notice in zlib.h
2367  // @(#) $Id$
2368 
2369 
2370 
2371 
2372 
2373 
2374  inline const char * zlibVersion() {
2375  return ZLIB_VERSION;
2376  }
2377 
2378  // exported to allow conversion of error code to string for compress() and
2379  // uncompress()
2380  inline const char * zError(int err) {
2381  return ERR_MSG(err);
2382  }
2383 
2384 
2385 
2386 
2387  inline voidpf zcalloc(voidpf opaque, unsigned items, unsigned size) {
2388  if (opaque) items += size - size; // make compiler happy
2389  return (voidpf)calloc(items, size);
2390  }
2391 
2392  inline void zcfree(voidpf opaque, voidpf ptr) {
2393  zfree(ptr);
2394  if (opaque) return; // make compiler happy
2395  }
2396 
2397 
2398 
2399  // inflate.c -- zlib interface to inflate modules
2400  // Copyright (C) 1995-1998 Mark Adler
2401  // For conditions of distribution and use, see copyright notice in zlib.h
2402 
2403  //struct inflate_blocks_state {int dummy;}; // for buggy compilers
2404 
2405  typedef enum {
2406  IM_METHOD, // waiting for method byte
2407  IM_FLAG, // waiting for flag byte
2408  IM_DICT4, // four dictionary check bytes to go
2409  IM_DICT3, // three dictionary check bytes to go
2410  IM_DICT2, // two dictionary check bytes to go
2411  IM_DICT1, // one dictionary check byte to go
2412  IM_DICT0, // waiting for inflateSetDictionary
2413  IM_BLOCKS, // decompressing blocks
2414  IM_CHECK4, // four check bytes to go
2415  IM_CHECK3, // three check bytes to go
2416  IM_CHECK2, // two check bytes to go
2417  IM_CHECK1, // one check byte to go
2418  IM_DONE, // finished check, done
2419  IM_BAD
2420  } // got an error--stay here
2421  inflate_mode;
2422 
2423  // inflate private state
2424  struct internal_state {
2425 
2426  // mode
2427  inflate_mode mode; // current inflate mode
2428 
2429  // mode dependent information
2430  union {
2431  uInt method; // if IM_FLAGS, method byte
2432  struct {
2433  uLong was; // computed check value
2434  uLong need; // stream check value
2435  } check; // if CHECK, check values to compare
2436  uInt marker; // if IM_BAD, inflateSync's marker bytes count
2437  } sub; // submode
2438 
2439  // mode independent information
2440  int nowrap; // flag for no wrapper
2441  uInt wbits; // log2(window size) (8..15, defaults to 15)
2442  inflate_blocks_statef
2443  *blocks; // current inflate_blocks state
2444 
2445  };
2446 
2447  inline int inflateReset(z_streamp z) {
2448  if (z == Z_NULL || z->state == Z_NULL)
2449  return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2450  z->total_in = z->total_out = 0;
2451  z->msg = Z_NULL;
2452  z->state->mode = z->state->nowrap ? IM_BLOCKS : IM_METHOD;
2453  inflate_blocks_reset(z->state->blocks, z, Z_NULL);
2454  LuTracev((stderr, "inflate: reset\n"));
2455  return Z_OK;
2456  }
2457 
2458  inline int inflateEnd(z_streamp z) {
2459  if (z == Z_NULL || z->state == Z_NULL || z->zfree == Z_NULL)
2460  return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2461  if (z->state->blocks != Z_NULL)
2462  inflate_blocks_free(z->state->blocks, z);
2463  ZFREE(z, z->state);
2464  z->state = Z_NULL;
2465  LuTracev((stderr, "inflate: end\n"));
2466  return Z_OK;
2467  }
2468 
2469 
2470  inline int inflateInit2(z_streamp z) {
2471  const char *version = ZLIB_VERSION; int stream_size = sizeof(z_stream);
2472  if (version == Z_NULL || version[0] != ZLIB_VERSION[0] || stream_size != sizeof(z_stream)) return Z_VERSION_ERROR;
2473 
2474  int w = -15; // MAX_WBITS: 32K LZ77 window.
2475  // Warning: reducing MAX_WBITS makes minigzip unable to extract .gz files created by gzip.
2476  // The memory requirements for deflate are (in bytes):
2477  // (1 << (windowBits+2)) + (1 << (memLevel+9))
2478  // that is: 128K for windowBits=15 + 128K for memLevel = 8 (default values)
2479  // plus a few kilobytes for small objects. For example, if you want to reduce
2480  // the default memory requirements from 256K to 128K, compile with
2481  // make CFLAGS="-O -DMAX_WBITS=14 -DMAX_MEM_LEVEL=7"
2482  // Of course this will generally degrade compression (there's no free lunch).
2483  //
2484  // The memory requirements for inflate are (in bytes) 1 << windowBits
2485  // that is, 32K for windowBits=15 (default value) plus a few kilobytes
2486  // for small objects.
2487 
2488  // initialize state
2489  if (z == Z_NULL) return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2490  z->msg = Z_NULL;
2491  if (z->zalloc == Z_NULL) {
2492  z->zalloc = zcalloc;
2493  z->opaque = (voidpf)0;
2494  }
2495  if (z->zfree == Z_NULL) z->zfree = zcfree;
2496  if ((z->state = (struct internal_state *)
2497  ZALLOC(z, 1, sizeof(struct internal_state))) == Z_NULL)
2498  return Z_MEM_ERROR;
2499  z->state->blocks = Z_NULL;
2500 
2501  // handle undocumented nowrap option (no zlib header or check)
2502  z->state->nowrap = 0;
2503  if (w < 0) {
2504  w = -w;
2505  z->state->nowrap = 1;
2506  }
2507 
2508  // set window size
2509  if (w < 8 || w > 15) {
2510  inflateEnd(z);
2511  return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2512  }
2513  z->state->wbits = (uInt)w;
2514 
2515  // create inflate_blocks state
2516  if ((z->state->blocks =
2517  inflate_blocks_new(z, z->state->nowrap ? Z_NULL : adler32, (uInt)1 << w))
2518  == Z_NULL) {
2519  inflateEnd(z);
2520  return Z_MEM_ERROR;
2521  }
2522  LuTracev((stderr, "inflate: allocated\n"));
2523 
2524  // reset state
2525  inflateReset(z);
2526  return Z_OK;
2527  }
2528 
2529 
2530 
2531 #define IM_NEEDBYTE {if(z->avail_in==0)return r;r=f;}
2532 #define IM_NEXTBYTE (z->avail_in--,z->total_in++,*z->next_in++)
2533 
2534  inline int inflate(z_streamp z, int f) {
2535  int r;
2536  uInt b;
2537 
2538  if (z == Z_NULL || z->state == Z_NULL || z->next_in == Z_NULL)
2539  return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2540  f = f == Z_FINISH ? Z_BUF_ERROR : Z_OK;
2541  r = Z_BUF_ERROR;
2542  for (;;) switch (z->state->mode) {
2543  case IM_METHOD:
2544  IM_NEEDBYTE
2545  if (((z->state->sub.method = IM_NEXTBYTE) & 0xf) != Z_DEFLATED) {
2546  z->state->mode = IM_BAD;
2547  z->msg = (char*)"unknown compression method";
2548  z->state->sub.marker = 5; // can't try inflateSync
2549  break;
2550  }
2551  if ((z->state->sub.method >> 4) + 8 > z->state->wbits) {
2552  z->state->mode = IM_BAD;
2553  z->msg = (char*)"invalid window size";
2554  z->state->sub.marker = 5; // can't try inflateSync
2555  break;
2556  }
2557  z->state->mode = IM_FLAG;
2558  case IM_FLAG:
2559  IM_NEEDBYTE
2560  b = IM_NEXTBYTE;
2561  if (((z->state->sub.method << 8) + b) % 31) {
2562  z->state->mode = IM_BAD;
2563  z->msg = (char*)"incorrect header check";
2564  z->state->sub.marker = 5; // can't try inflateSync
2565  break;
2566  }
2567  LuTracev((stderr, "inflate: zlib header ok\n"));
2568  if (!(b & PRESET_DICT)) {
2569  z->state->mode = IM_BLOCKS;
2570  break;
2571  }
2572  z->state->mode = IM_DICT4;
2573  case IM_DICT4:
2574  IM_NEEDBYTE
2575  z->state->sub.check.need = (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE << 24;
2576  z->state->mode = IM_DICT3;
2577  case IM_DICT3:
2578  IM_NEEDBYTE
2579  z->state->sub.check.need += (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE << 16;
2580  z->state->mode = IM_DICT2;
2581  case IM_DICT2:
2582  IM_NEEDBYTE
2583  z->state->sub.check.need += (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE << 8;
2584  z->state->mode = IM_DICT1;
2585  case IM_DICT1:
2586  IM_NEEDBYTE; r;
2587  z->state->sub.check.need += (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE;
2588  z->adler = z->state->sub.check.need;
2589  z->state->mode = IM_DICT0;
2590  return Z_NEED_DICT;
2591  case IM_DICT0:
2592  z->state->mode = IM_BAD;
2593  z->msg = (char*)"need dictionary";
2594  z->state->sub.marker = 0; // can try inflateSync
2595  return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2596  case IM_BLOCKS:
2597  r = inflate_blocks(z->state->blocks, z, r);
2598  if (r == Z_DATA_ERROR) {
2599  z->state->mode = IM_BAD;
2600  z->state->sub.marker = 0; // can try inflateSync
2601  break;
2602  }
2603  if (r == Z_OK)
2604  r = f;
2605  if (r != Z_STREAM_END)
2606  return r;
2607  r = f;
2608  inflate_blocks_reset(z->state->blocks, z, &z->state->sub.check.was);
2609  if (z->state->nowrap) {
2610  z->state->mode = IM_DONE;
2611  break;
2612  }
2613  z->state->mode = IM_CHECK4;
2614  case IM_CHECK4:
2615  IM_NEEDBYTE
2616  z->state->sub.check.need = (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE << 24;
2617  z->state->mode = IM_CHECK3;
2618  case IM_CHECK3:
2619  IM_NEEDBYTE
2620  z->state->sub.check.need += (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE << 16;
2621  z->state->mode = IM_CHECK2;
2622  case IM_CHECK2:
2623  IM_NEEDBYTE
2624  z->state->sub.check.need += (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE << 8;
2625  z->state->mode = IM_CHECK1;
2626  case IM_CHECK1:
2627  IM_NEEDBYTE
2628  z->state->sub.check.need += (uLong)IM_NEXTBYTE;
2629 
2630  if (z->state->sub.check.was != z->state->sub.check.need) {
2631  z->state->mode = IM_BAD;
2632  z->msg = (char*)"incorrect data check";
2633  z->state->sub.marker = 5; // can't try inflateSync
2634  break;
2635  }
2636  LuTracev((stderr, "inflate: zlib check ok\n"));
2637  z->state->mode = IM_DONE;
2638  case IM_DONE:
2639  return Z_STREAM_END;
2640  case IM_BAD:
2641  return Z_DATA_ERROR;
2642  default:
2643  return Z_STREAM_ERROR;
2644  }
2645  }
2646 
2647 
2648 
2649 
2650 
2651  // unzip.c -- IO on .zip files using zlib
2652  // Version 0.15 beta, Mar 19th, 1998,
2653  // Read unzip.h for more info
2654 
2655 
2656 
2657 
2658 #define UNZ_BUFSIZE (16384)
2659 #define UNZ_MAXFILENAMEINZIP (256)
2660 #define SIZECENTRALDIRITEM (0x2e)
2661 #define SIZEZIPLOCALHEADER (0x1e)
2662 
2663 
2664 
2665 
2666  const char unz_copyright[] = " unzip 0.15 Copyright 1998 Gilles Vollant ";
2667 
2668  // unz_file_info_interntal contain internal info about a file in zipfile
2669  typedef struct unz_file_info_internal_s {
2670  uLong offset_curfile;// relative offset of local header 4 bytes
2671  } unz_file_info_internal;
2672 
2673 
2674  typedef struct {
2675  bool is_handle; // either a handle or memory
2676  bool canseek;
2677  // for handles:
2678  HANDLE h; bool herr; unsigned long initial_offset; bool mustclosehandle;
2679  // for memory:
2680  void *buf; unsigned int len, pos; // if it's a memory block
2681  } LUFILE;
2682 
2683 
2684  inline LUFILE *lufopen(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags, ZRESULT *err) {
2685  if (flags != ZIP_HANDLE && flags != ZIP_FILENAME && flags != ZIP_MEMORY) {
2686  *err = ZR_ARGS; return NULL;
2687  }
2688  //
2689  HANDLE h = 0; bool canseek = false; *err = ZR_OK;
2690  bool mustclosehandle = false;
2691  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE || flags == ZIP_FILENAME) {
2692  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE) {
2693  HANDLE hf = (HANDLE)z;
2694  h = hf; mustclosehandle = false;
2695 #ifdef DuplicateHandle
2696  BOOL res = DuplicateHandle(GetCurrentProcess(), hf, GetCurrentProcess(), &h, 0, FALSE, DUPLICATE_SAME_ACCESS);
2697  if (!res) mustclosehandle = true;
2698 #endif
2699  } else {
2700 
2701  h = CreateFile((const TCHAR*)z, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, NULL);
2702  if (h == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
2703  *err = ZR_NOFILE; return NULL;
2704  }
2705  mustclosehandle = true;
2706  }
2707  // test if we can seek on it. We can't use GetFileType(h)==FILE_TYPE_DISK since it's not on CE.
2708  DWORD res = GetFilePosU(h);
2709  canseek = (res != 0xFFFFFFFF);
2710  }
2711  LUFILE *lf = new LUFILE;
2712  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE || flags == ZIP_FILENAME) {
2713  lf->is_handle = true; lf->mustclosehandle = mustclosehandle;
2714  lf->canseek = canseek;
2715  lf->h = h; lf->herr = false;
2716  lf->initial_offset = 0;
2717  if (canseek) lf->initial_offset = GetFilePosU(h);
2718  } else {
2719  lf->is_handle = false;
2720  lf->canseek = true;
2721  lf->mustclosehandle = false;
2722  lf->buf = z; lf->len = len; lf->pos = 0; lf->initial_offset = 0;
2723  }
2724  *err = ZR_OK;
2725  return lf;
2726  }
2727 
2728 
2729  inline int lufclose(LUFILE *stream) {
2730  if (stream == NULL) return EOF;
2731 
2732  if (stream->mustclosehandle) CloseHandle(stream->h);
2733  delete stream;
2734  return 0;
2735  }
2736 
2737  inline int luferror(LUFILE *stream) {
2738  if (stream->is_handle && stream->herr) return 1;
2739  else return 0;
2740  }
2741 
2742  inline long int luftell(LUFILE *stream) {
2743  if (stream->is_handle && stream->canseek) return GetFilePosU(stream->h) - stream->initial_offset;
2744  else if (stream->is_handle) return 0;
2745  else return stream->pos;
2746  }
2747 
2748  inline int lufseek(LUFILE *stream, long offset, int whence) {
2749  if (stream->is_handle && stream->canseek) {
2750 
2751  if (whence == SEEK_SET) SetFilePointer(stream->h, stream->initial_offset + offset, 0, FILE_BEGIN);
2752  else if (whence == SEEK_CUR) SetFilePointer(stream->h, offset, NULL, FILE_CURRENT);
2753  else if (whence == SEEK_END) SetFilePointer(stream->h, offset, NULL, FILE_END);
2754  else return 19; // EINVAL
2755  return 0;
2756  } else if (stream->is_handle) return 29; // ESPIPE
2757  else {
2758  if (whence == SEEK_SET) stream->pos = offset;
2759  else if (whence == SEEK_CUR) stream->pos += offset;
2760  else if (whence == SEEK_END) stream->pos = stream->len + offset;
2761  return 0;
2762  }
2763  }
2764 
2765 
2766  inline size_t lufread(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t n, LUFILE *stream) {
2767  unsigned int toread = (unsigned int)(size*n);
2768  if (stream->is_handle) {
2769 
2770  DWORD red; BOOL res = ReadFile(stream->h, ptr, toread, &red, NULL);
2771  if (!res) stream->herr = true;
2772  return red / size;
2773  }
2774  if (stream->pos + toread > stream->len) toread = stream->len - stream->pos;
2775  memcpy(ptr, (char*)stream->buf + stream->pos, toread); DWORD red = toread;
2776  stream->pos += red;
2777  return red / size;
2778  }
2779 
2780 
2781 
2782 
2783  // file_in_zip_read_info_s contain internal information about a file in zipfile,
2784  // when reading and decompress it
2785  typedef struct {
2786  char *read_buffer; // internal buffer for compressed data
2787  z_stream stream; // zLib stream structure for inflate
2788 
2789  uLong pos_in_zipfile; // position in byte on the zipfile, for fseek
2790  uLong stream_initialised; // flag set if stream structure is initialised
2791 
2792  uLong offset_local_extrafield;// offset of the local extra field
2793  uInt size_local_extrafield;// size of the local extra field
2794  uLong pos_local_extrafield; // position in the local extra field in read
2795 
2796  uLong crc32; // crc32 of all data uncompressed
2797  uLong crc32_wait; // crc32 we must obtain after decompress all
2798  uLong rest_read_compressed; // number of byte to be decompressed
2799  uLong rest_read_uncompressed;//number of byte to be obtained after decomp
2800  LUFILE* file; // io structore of the zipfile
2801  uLong compression_method; // compression method (0==store)
2802  uLong byte_before_the_zipfile;// byte before the zipfile, (>0 for sfx)
2803  bool encrypted; // is it encrypted?
2804  unsigned long keys[3]; // decryption keys, initialized by unzOpenCurrentFile
2805  int encheadleft; // the first call(s) to unzReadCurrentFile will read this many encryption-header bytes first
2806  char crcenctest; // if encrypted, we'll check the encryption buffer against this
2807  } file_in_zip_read_info_s;
2808 
2809 
2810  // unz_s contain internal information about the zipfile
2811  typedef struct {
2812  LUFILE* file; // io structore of the zipfile
2813  unz_global_info gi; // public global information
2814  uLong byte_before_the_zipfile;// byte before the zipfile, (>0 for sfx)
2815  uLong num_file; // number of the current file in the zipfile
2816  uLong pos_in_central_dir; // pos of the current file in the central dir
2817  uLong current_file_ok; // flag about the usability of the current file
2818  uLong central_pos; // position of the beginning of the central dir
2819 
2820  uLong size_central_dir; // size of the central directory
2821  uLong offset_central_dir; // offset of start of central directory with respect to the starting disk number
2822 
2823  unz_file_info cur_file_info; // public info about the current file in zip
2824  unz_file_info_internal cur_file_info_internal; // private info about it
2825  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read; // structure about the current file if we are decompressing it
2826  } unz_s, *unzFile;
2827 
2828 
2829  inline int unzStringFileNameCompare(const char* fileName1, const char* fileName2, int iCaseSensitivity);
2830  // Compare two filename (fileName1,fileName2).
2831 
2832  inline z_off_t unztell(unzFile file);
2833  // Give the current position in uncompressed data
2834 
2835  inline int unzeof(unzFile file);
2836  // return 1 if the end of file was reached, 0 elsewhere
2837 
2838  inline int unzGetLocalExtrafield(unzFile file, voidp buf, unsigned len);
2839  // Read extra field from the current file (opened by unzOpenCurrentFile)
2840  // This is the local-header version of the extra field (sometimes, there is
2841  // more info in the local-header version than in the central-header)
2842  //
2843  // if buf==NULL, it return the size of the local extra field
2844  //
2845  // if buf!=NULL, len is the size of the buffer, the extra header is copied in
2846  // buf.
2847  // the return value is the number of bytes copied in buf, or (if <0)
2848  // the error code
2849 
2850 
2851 
2852  // ===========================================================================
2853  // Read a byte from a gz_stream; update next_in and avail_in. Return EOF
2854  // for end of file.
2855  // IN assertion: the stream s has been sucessfully opened for reading.
2856 
2857  inline int unzlocal_getByte(LUFILE *fin, int *pi) {
2858  unsigned char c;
2859  int err = (int)lufread(&c, 1, 1, fin);
2860  if (err == 1) {
2861  *pi = (int)c;
2862  return UNZ_OK;
2863  } else {
2864  if (luferror(fin)) return UNZ_ERRNO;
2865  else return UNZ_EOF;
2866  }
2867  }
2868 
2869 
2870  // ===========================================================================
2871  // Reads a long in LSB order from the given gz_stream. Sets
2872  inline int unzlocal_getShort(LUFILE *fin, uLong *pX) {
2873  uLong x;
2874  int i;
2875  int err;
2876 
2877  err = unzlocal_getByte(fin, &i);
2878  x = (uLong)i;
2879 
2880  if (err == UNZ_OK)
2881  err = unzlocal_getByte(fin, &i);
2882  x += ((uLong)i) << 8;
2883 
2884  if (err == UNZ_OK)
2885  *pX = x;
2886  else
2887  *pX = 0;
2888  return err;
2889  }
2890 
2891  inline int unzlocal_getLong(LUFILE *fin, uLong *pX) {
2892  uLong x;
2893  int i;
2894  int err;
2895 
2896  err = unzlocal_getByte(fin, &i);
2897  x = (uLong)i;
2898 
2899  if (err == UNZ_OK)
2900  err = unzlocal_getByte(fin, &i);
2901  x += ((uLong)i) << 8;
2902 
2903  if (err == UNZ_OK)
2904  err = unzlocal_getByte(fin, &i);
2905  x += ((uLong)i) << 16;
2906 
2907  if (err == UNZ_OK)
2908  err = unzlocal_getByte(fin, &i);
2909  x += ((uLong)i) << 24;
2910 
2911  if (err == UNZ_OK)
2912  *pX = x;
2913  else
2914  *pX = 0;
2915  return err;
2916  }
2917 
2918 
2919  // My own strcmpi / strcasecmp
2920  inline int strcmpcasenosensitive_internal(const char* fileName1, const char *fileName2) {
2921  for (;;) {
2922  char c1 = *(fileName1++);
2923  char c2 = *(fileName2++);
2924  if ((c1 >= 'a') && (c1 <= 'z'))
2925  c1 -= (char)0x20;
2926  if ((c2 >= 'a') && (c2 <= 'z'))
2927  c2 -= (char)0x20;
2928  if (c1 == '\0')
2929  return ((c2 == '\0') ? 0 : -1);
2930  if (c2 == '\0')
2931  return 1;
2932  if (c1 < c2)
2933  return -1;
2934  if (c1 > c2)
2935  return 1;
2936  }
2937  }
2938 
2939 
2940 
2941 
2942  //
2943  // Compare two filename (fileName1,fileName2).
2944  // If iCaseSenisivity = 1, comparision is case sensitivity (like strcmp)
2945  // If iCaseSenisivity = 2, comparision is not case sensitivity (like strcmpi or strcasecmp)
2946  //
2947  inline int unzStringFileNameCompare(const char*fileName1, const char*fileName2, int iCaseSensitivity) {
2948  if (iCaseSensitivity == 1) return strcmp(fileName1, fileName2);
2949  else return strcmpcasenosensitive_internal(fileName1, fileName2);
2950  }
2951 
2952 #define BUFREADCOMMENT (0x400)
2953 
2954 
2955  // Locate the Central directory of a zipfile (at the end, just before
2956  // the global comment). Lu bugfix 2005.07.26 - returns 0xFFFFFFFF if not found,
2957  // rather than 0, since 0 is a valid central-dir-location for an empty zipfile.
2958  inline uLong unzlocal_SearchCentralDir(LUFILE *fin) {
2959  if (lufseek(fin, 0, SEEK_END) != 0) return 0xFFFFFFFF;
2960  uLong uSizeFile = luftell(fin);
2961 
2962  uLong uMaxBack = 0xffff; // maximum size of global comment
2963  if (uMaxBack > uSizeFile) uMaxBack = uSizeFile;
2964 
2965  unsigned char *buf = (unsigned char*)zmalloc(BUFREADCOMMENT + 4);
2966  if (buf == NULL) return 0xFFFFFFFF;
2967  uLong uPosFound = 0xFFFFFFFF;
2968 
2969  uLong uBackRead = 4;
2970  while (uBackRead < uMaxBack) {
2971  uLong uReadSize, uReadPos;
2972  int i;
2973  if (uBackRead + BUFREADCOMMENT > uMaxBack) uBackRead = uMaxBack;
2974  else uBackRead += BUFREADCOMMENT;
2975  uReadPos = uSizeFile - uBackRead;
2976  uReadSize = ((BUFREADCOMMENT + 4) < (uSizeFile - uReadPos)) ? (BUFREADCOMMENT + 4) : (uSizeFile - uReadPos);
2977  if (lufseek(fin, uReadPos, SEEK_SET) != 0) break;
2978  if (lufread(buf, (uInt)uReadSize, 1, fin) != 1) break;
2979  for (i = (int)uReadSize - 3; (i--) >= 0;) {
2980  if (((*(buf + i)) == 0x50) && ((*(buf + i + 1)) == 0x4b) && ((*(buf + i + 2)) == 0x05) && ((*(buf + i + 3)) == 0x06)) {
2981  uPosFound = uReadPos + i; break;
2982  }
2983  }
2984  if (uPosFound != 0) break;
2985  }
2986  if (buf) zfree(buf);
2987  return uPosFound;
2988  }
2989 
2990 
2991  inline int unzGoToFirstFile(unzFile file);
2992  inline int unzCloseCurrentFile(unzFile file);
2993 
2994  // Open a Zip file.
2995  // If the zipfile cannot be opened (file don't exist or in not valid), return NULL.
2996  // Otherwise, the return value is a unzFile Handle, usable with other unzip functions
2997  inline unzFile unzOpenInternal(LUFILE *fin) {
2998  if (fin == NULL) return NULL;
2999  if (unz_copyright[0] != ' ') {
3000  lufclose(fin); return NULL;
3001  }
3002 
3003  int err = UNZ_OK;
3004  unz_s us = { 0 };
3005  uLong central_pos = 0, uL = 0;
3006  central_pos = unzlocal_SearchCentralDir(fin);
3007  if (central_pos == 0xFFFFFFFF) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3008  if (err == UNZ_OK && lufseek(fin, central_pos, SEEK_SET) != 0) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3009  // the signature, already checked
3010  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getLong(fin, &uL) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3011  // number of this disk
3012  uLong number_disk = 0; // number of the current dist, used for spanning ZIP, unsupported, always 0
3013  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getShort(fin, &number_disk) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3014  // number of the disk with the start of the central directory
3015  uLong number_disk_with_CD = 0; // number the the disk with central dir, used for spaning ZIP, unsupported, always 0
3016  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getShort(fin, &number_disk_with_CD) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3017  // total number of entries in the central dir on this disk
3018  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getShort(fin, &us.gi.number_entry) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3019  // total number of entries in the central dir
3020  uLong number_entry_CD = 0; // total number of entries in the central dir (same than number_entry on nospan)
3021  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getShort(fin, &number_entry_CD) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3022  if (err == UNZ_OK && ((number_entry_CD != us.gi.number_entry) || (number_disk_with_CD != 0) || (number_disk != 0))) err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3023  // size of the central directory
3024  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getLong(fin, &us.size_central_dir) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3025  // offset of start of central directory with respect to the starting disk number
3026  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getLong(fin, &us.offset_central_dir) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3027  // zipfile comment length
3028  if (err == UNZ_OK && unzlocal_getShort(fin, &us.gi.size_comment) != UNZ_OK) err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3029  if (err == UNZ_OK && ((central_pos + fin->initial_offset < us.offset_central_dir + us.size_central_dir) && (err == UNZ_OK))) err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3030  if (err != UNZ_OK) {
3031  lufclose(fin); return NULL;
3032  }
3033 
3034  us.file = fin;
3035  us.byte_before_the_zipfile = central_pos + fin->initial_offset - (us.offset_central_dir + us.size_central_dir);
3036  us.central_pos = central_pos;
3037  us.pfile_in_zip_read = NULL;
3038  fin->initial_offset = 0; // since the zipfile itself is expected to handle this
3039 
3040  unz_s *s = (unz_s*)zmalloc(sizeof(unz_s));
3041  *s = us;
3042  unzGoToFirstFile((unzFile)s);
3043  return (unzFile)s;
3044  }
3045 
3046 
3047 
3048  // Close a ZipFile opened with unzipOpen.
3049  // If there is files inside the .Zip opened with unzipOpenCurrentFile (see later),
3050  // these files MUST be closed with unzipCloseCurrentFile before call unzipClose.
3051  // return UNZ_OK if there is no problem.
3052  inline int unzClose(unzFile file) {
3053  unz_s* s;
3054  if (file == NULL)
3055  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3056  s = (unz_s*)file;
3057 
3058  if (s->pfile_in_zip_read != NULL)
3059  unzCloseCurrentFile(file);
3060 
3061  lufclose(s->file);
3062  if (s) zfree(s); // unused s=0;
3063  return UNZ_OK;
3064  }
3065 
3066 
3067  // Write info about the ZipFile in the *pglobal_info structure.
3068  // No preparation of the structure is needed
3069  // return UNZ_OK if there is no problem.
3070  inline int unzGetGlobalInfo(unzFile file, unz_global_info *pglobal_info) {
3071  unz_s* s;
3072  if (file == NULL)
3073  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3074  s = (unz_s*)file;
3075  *pglobal_info = s->gi;
3076  return UNZ_OK;
3077  }
3078 
3079 
3080  // Translate date/time from Dos format to tm_unz (readable more easilty)
3081  inline void unzlocal_DosDateToTmuDate(uLong ulDosDate, tm_unz* ptm) {
3082  uLong uDate;
3083  uDate = (uLong)(ulDosDate >> 16);
3084  ptm->tm_mday = (uInt)(uDate & 0x1f);
3085  ptm->tm_mon = (uInt)((((uDate) & 0x1E0) / 0x20) - 1);
3086  ptm->tm_year = (uInt)(((uDate & 0x0FE00) / 0x0200) + 1980);
3087 
3088  ptm->tm_hour = (uInt)((ulDosDate & 0xF800) / 0x800);
3089  ptm->tm_min = (uInt)((ulDosDate & 0x7E0) / 0x20);
3090  ptm->tm_sec = (uInt)(2 * (ulDosDate & 0x1f));
3091  }
3092 
3093  // Get Info about the current file in the zipfile, with internal only info
3094  inline int unzlocal_GetCurrentFileInfoInternal(unzFile file,
3095  unz_file_info *pfile_info,
3096  unz_file_info_internal
3097  *pfile_info_internal,
3098  char *szFileName,
3099  uLong fileNameBufferSize,
3100  void *extraField,
3101  uLong extraFieldBufferSize,
3102  char *szComment,
3103  uLong commentBufferSize);
3104 
3105  inline int unzlocal_GetCurrentFileInfoInternal(unzFile file, unz_file_info *pfile_info,
3106  unz_file_info_internal *pfile_info_internal, char *szFileName,
3107  uLong fileNameBufferSize, void *extraField, uLong extraFieldBufferSize,
3108  char *szComment, uLong commentBufferSize) {
3109  unz_s* s;
3110  unz_file_info file_info;
3111  unz_file_info_internal file_info_internal;
3112  int err = UNZ_OK;
3113  uLong uMagic;
3114  long lSeek = 0;
3115 
3116  if (file == NULL)
3117  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3118  s = (unz_s*)file;
3119  if (lufseek(s->file, s->pos_in_central_dir + s->byte_before_the_zipfile, SEEK_SET) != 0)
3120  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3121 
3122 
3123  // we check the magic
3124  if (err == UNZ_OK)
3125  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &uMagic) != UNZ_OK)
3126  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3127  else if (uMagic != 0x02014b50)
3128  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3129 
3130  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.version) != UNZ_OK)
3131  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3132 
3133  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.version_needed) != UNZ_OK)
3134  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3135 
3136  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.flag) != UNZ_OK)
3137  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3138 
3139  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.compression_method) != UNZ_OK)
3140  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3141 
3142  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &file_info.dosDate) != UNZ_OK)
3143  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3144 
3145  unzlocal_DosDateToTmuDate(file_info.dosDate, &file_info.tmu_date);
3146 
3147  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &file_info.crc) != UNZ_OK)
3148  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3149 
3150  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &file_info.compressed_size) != UNZ_OK)
3151  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3152 
3153  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &file_info.uncompressed_size) != UNZ_OK)
3154  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3155 
3156  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.size_filename) != UNZ_OK)
3157  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3158 
3159  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.size_file_extra) != UNZ_OK)
3160  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3161 
3162  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.size_file_comment) != UNZ_OK)
3163  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3164 
3165  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.disk_num_start) != UNZ_OK)
3166  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3167 
3168  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &file_info.internal_fa) != UNZ_OK)
3169  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3170 
3171  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &file_info.external_fa) != UNZ_OK)
3172  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3173 
3174  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &file_info_internal.offset_curfile) != UNZ_OK)
3175  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3176 
3177  lSeek += file_info.size_filename;
3178  if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (szFileName != NULL)) {
3179  uLong uSizeRead;
3180  if (file_info.size_filename < fileNameBufferSize) {
3181  *(szFileName + file_info.size_filename) = '\0';
3182  uSizeRead = file_info.size_filename;
3183  } else
3184  uSizeRead = fileNameBufferSize;
3185 
3186  if ((file_info.size_filename > 0) && (fileNameBufferSize > 0))
3187  if (lufread(szFileName, (uInt)uSizeRead, 1, s->file) != 1)
3188  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3189  lSeek -= uSizeRead;
3190  }
3191 
3192 
3193  if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (extraField != NULL)) {
3194  uLong uSizeRead;
3195  if (file_info.size_file_extra < extraFieldBufferSize)
3196  uSizeRead = file_info.size_file_extra;
3197  else
3198  uSizeRead = extraFieldBufferSize;
3199 
3200  if (lSeek != 0)
3201  if (lufseek(s->file, lSeek, SEEK_CUR) == 0)
3202  lSeek = 0;
3203  else
3204  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3205  if ((file_info.size_file_extra > 0) && (extraFieldBufferSize > 0))
3206  if (lufread(extraField, (uInt)uSizeRead, 1, s->file) != 1)
3207  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3208  lSeek += file_info.size_file_extra - uSizeRead;
3209  } else
3210  lSeek += file_info.size_file_extra;
3211 
3212 
3213  if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (szComment != NULL)) {
3214  uLong uSizeRead;
3215  if (file_info.size_file_comment < commentBufferSize) {
3216  *(szComment + file_info.size_file_comment) = '\0';
3217  uSizeRead = file_info.size_file_comment;
3218  } else
3219  uSizeRead = commentBufferSize;
3220 
3221  if (lSeek != 0)
3222  if (lufseek(s->file, lSeek, SEEK_CUR) == 0) {
3223  } // unused lSeek=0;
3224  else
3225  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3226  if ((file_info.size_file_comment > 0) && (commentBufferSize > 0))
3227  if (lufread(szComment, (uInt)uSizeRead, 1, s->file) != 1)
3228  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3229  //unused lSeek+=file_info.size_file_comment - uSizeRead;
3230  } else {
3231  } //unused lSeek+=file_info.size_file_comment;
3232 
3233  if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (pfile_info != NULL))
3234  *pfile_info = file_info;
3235 
3236  if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (pfile_info_internal != NULL))
3237  *pfile_info_internal = file_info_internal;
3238 
3239  return err;
3240  }
3241 
3242 
3243 
3244  // Write info about the ZipFile in the *pglobal_info structure.
3245  // No preparation of the structure is needed
3246  // return UNZ_OK if there is no problem.
3247  inline int unzGetCurrentFileInfo(unzFile file, unz_file_info *pfile_info,
3248  char *szFileName, uLong fileNameBufferSize, void *extraField, uLong extraFieldBufferSize,
3249  char *szComment, uLong commentBufferSize) {
3250  return unzlocal_GetCurrentFileInfoInternal(file, pfile_info, NULL, szFileName, fileNameBufferSize,
3251  extraField, extraFieldBufferSize, szComment, commentBufferSize);
3252  }
3253 
3254 
3255  // Set the current file of the zipfile to the first file.
3256  // return UNZ_OK if there is no problem
3257  inline int unzGoToFirstFile(unzFile file) {
3258  int err;
3259  unz_s* s;
3260  if (file == NULL) return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3261  s = (unz_s*)file;
3262  s->pos_in_central_dir = s->offset_central_dir;
3263  s->num_file = 0;
3264  err = unzlocal_GetCurrentFileInfoInternal(file, &s->cur_file_info,
3265  &s->cur_file_info_internal,
3266  NULL, 0, NULL, 0, NULL, 0);
3267  s->current_file_ok = (err == UNZ_OK);
3268  return err;
3269  }
3270 
3271 
3272  // Set the current file of the zipfile to the next file.
3273  // return UNZ_OK if there is no problem
3274  // return UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE if the actual file was the latest.
3275  inline int unzGoToNextFile(unzFile file) {
3276  unz_s* s;
3277  int err;
3278 
3279  if (file == NULL)
3280  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3281  s = (unz_s*)file;
3282  if (!s->current_file_ok)
3283  return UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE;
3284  if (s->num_file + 1 == s->gi.number_entry)
3285  return UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE;
3286 
3287  s->pos_in_central_dir += SIZECENTRALDIRITEM + s->cur_file_info.size_filename +
3288  s->cur_file_info.size_file_extra + s->cur_file_info.size_file_comment;
3289  s->num_file++;
3290  err = unzlocal_GetCurrentFileInfoInternal(file, &s->cur_file_info,
3291  &s->cur_file_info_internal,
3292  NULL, 0, NULL, 0, NULL, 0);
3293  s->current_file_ok = (err == UNZ_OK);
3294  return err;
3295  }
3296 
3297 
3298  // Try locate the file szFileName in the zipfile.
3299  // For the iCaseSensitivity signification, see unzStringFileNameCompare
3300  // return value :
3301  // UNZ_OK if the file is found. It becomes the current file.
3302  // UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE if the file is not found
3303  inline int unzLocateFile(unzFile file, const char *szFileName, int iCaseSensitivity) {
3304  unz_s* s;
3305  int err;
3306 
3307 
3308  uLong num_fileSaved;
3309  uLong pos_in_central_dirSaved;
3310 
3311 
3312  if (file == NULL)
3313  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3314 
3315  if (strlen(szFileName) >= UNZ_MAXFILENAMEINZIP)
3316  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3317 
3318  s = (unz_s*)file;
3319  if (!s->current_file_ok)
3320  return UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE;
3321 
3322  num_fileSaved = s->num_file;
3323  pos_in_central_dirSaved = s->pos_in_central_dir;
3324 
3325  err = unzGoToFirstFile(file);
3326 
3327  while (err == UNZ_OK) {
3328  char szCurrentFileName[UNZ_MAXFILENAMEINZIP + 1];
3329  unzGetCurrentFileInfo(file, NULL,
3330  szCurrentFileName, sizeof(szCurrentFileName) - 1,
3331  NULL, 0, NULL, 0);
3332  if (unzStringFileNameCompare(szCurrentFileName, szFileName, iCaseSensitivity) == 0)
3333  return UNZ_OK;
3334  err = unzGoToNextFile(file);
3335  }
3336 
3337  s->num_file = num_fileSaved;
3338  s->pos_in_central_dir = pos_in_central_dirSaved;
3339  return err;
3340  }
3341 
3342 
3343  // Read the local header of the current zipfile
3344  // Check the coherency of the local header and info in the end of central
3345  // directory about this file
3346  // store in *piSizeVar the size of extra info in local header
3347  // (filename and size of extra field data)
3348  inline int unzlocal_CheckCurrentFileCoherencyHeader(unz_s *s, uInt *piSizeVar,
3349  uLong *poffset_local_extrafield, uInt *psize_local_extrafield) {
3350  uLong uMagic, uData, uFlags;
3351  uLong size_filename;
3352  uLong size_extra_field;
3353  int err = UNZ_OK;
3354 
3355  *piSizeVar = 0;
3356  *poffset_local_extrafield = 0;
3357  *psize_local_extrafield = 0;
3358 
3359  if (lufseek(s->file, s->cur_file_info_internal.offset_curfile + s->byte_before_the_zipfile, SEEK_SET) != 0)
3360  return UNZ_ERRNO;
3361 
3362 
3363  if (err == UNZ_OK)
3364  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &uMagic) != UNZ_OK)
3365  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3366  else if (uMagic != 0x04034b50)
3367  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3368 
3369  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &uData) != UNZ_OK)
3370  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3371  // else if ((err==UNZ_OK) && (uData!=s->cur_file_info.wVersion))
3372  // err=UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3373  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &uFlags) != UNZ_OK)
3374  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3375 
3376  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &uData) != UNZ_OK)
3377  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3378  else if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (uData != s->cur_file_info.compression_method))
3379  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3380 
3381  if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (s->cur_file_info.compression_method != 0) &&
3382  (s->cur_file_info.compression_method != Z_DEFLATED))
3383  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3384 
3385  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &uData) != UNZ_OK) // date/time
3386  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3387 
3388  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &uData) != UNZ_OK) // crc
3389  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3390  else if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (uData != s->cur_file_info.crc) &&
3391  ((uFlags & 8) == 0))
3392  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3393 
3394  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &uData) != UNZ_OK) // size compr
3395  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3396  else if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (uData != s->cur_file_info.compressed_size) &&
3397  ((uFlags & 8) == 0))
3398  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3399 
3400  if (unzlocal_getLong(s->file, &uData) != UNZ_OK) // size uncompr
3401  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3402  else if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (uData != s->cur_file_info.uncompressed_size) &&
3403  ((uFlags & 8) == 0))
3404  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3405 
3406 
3407  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &size_filename) != UNZ_OK)
3408  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3409  else if ((err == UNZ_OK) && (size_filename != s->cur_file_info.size_filename))
3410  err = UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3411 
3412  *piSizeVar += (uInt)size_filename;
3413 
3414  if (unzlocal_getShort(s->file, &size_extra_field) != UNZ_OK)
3415  err = UNZ_ERRNO;
3416  *poffset_local_extrafield = s->cur_file_info_internal.offset_curfile +
3417  SIZEZIPLOCALHEADER + size_filename;
3418  *psize_local_extrafield = (uInt)size_extra_field;
3419 
3420  *piSizeVar += (uInt)size_extra_field;
3421 
3422  return err;
3423  }
3424 
3425 
3426 
3427 
3428 
3429  // Open for reading data the current file in the zipfile.
3430  // If there is no error and the file is opened, the return value is UNZ_OK.
3431  inline int unzOpenCurrentFile(unzFile file, const char *password) {
3432  int err;
3433  int Store;
3434  uInt iSizeVar;
3435  unz_s* s;
3436  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read_info;
3437  uLong offset_local_extrafield; // offset of the local extra field
3438  uInt size_local_extrafield; // size of the local extra field
3439 
3440  if (file == NULL)
3441  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3442  s = (unz_s*)file;
3443  if (!s->current_file_ok)
3444  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3445 
3446  if (s->pfile_in_zip_read != NULL)
3447  unzCloseCurrentFile(file);
3448 
3449  if (unzlocal_CheckCurrentFileCoherencyHeader(s, &iSizeVar,
3450  &offset_local_extrafield, &size_local_extrafield) != UNZ_OK)
3451  return UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3452 
3453  pfile_in_zip_read_info = (file_in_zip_read_info_s*)zmalloc(sizeof(file_in_zip_read_info_s));
3454  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info == NULL)
3455  return UNZ_INTERNALERROR;
3456 
3457  pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer = (char*)zmalloc(UNZ_BUFSIZE);
3458  pfile_in_zip_read_info->offset_local_extrafield = offset_local_extrafield;
3459  pfile_in_zip_read_info->size_local_extrafield = size_local_extrafield;
3460  pfile_in_zip_read_info->pos_local_extrafield = 0;
3461 
3462  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer == NULL) {
3463  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info != 0) zfree(pfile_in_zip_read_info); //unused pfile_in_zip_read_info=0;
3464  return UNZ_INTERNALERROR;
3465  }
3466 
3467  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream_initialised = 0;
3468 
3469  if ((s->cur_file_info.compression_method != 0) && (s->cur_file_info.compression_method != Z_DEFLATED)) { // unused err=UNZ_BADZIPFILE;
3470  }
3471  Store = s->cur_file_info.compression_method == 0;
3472 
3473  pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32_wait = s->cur_file_info.crc;
3474  pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32 = 0;
3475  pfile_in_zip_read_info->compression_method = s->cur_file_info.compression_method;
3476  pfile_in_zip_read_info->file = s->file;
3477  pfile_in_zip_read_info->byte_before_the_zipfile = s->byte_before_the_zipfile;
3478 
3479  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.total_out = 0;
3480 
3481  if (!Store) {
3482  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.zalloc = (alloc_func)0;
3483  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.zfree = (free_func)0;
3484  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.opaque = (voidpf)0;
3485 
3486  err = inflateInit2(&pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream);
3487  if (err == Z_OK)
3488  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream_initialised = 1;
3489  // windowBits is passed < 0 to tell that there is no zlib header.
3490  // Note that in this case inflate *requires* an extra "dummy" byte
3491  // after the compressed stream in order to complete decompression and
3492  // return Z_STREAM_END.
3493  // In unzip, i don't wait absolutely Z_STREAM_END because I known the
3494  // size of both compressed and uncompressed data
3495  }
3496  pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_compressed = s->cur_file_info.compressed_size;
3497  pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed = s->cur_file_info.uncompressed_size;
3498  pfile_in_zip_read_info->encrypted = (s->cur_file_info.flag & 1) != 0;
3499  bool extlochead = (s->cur_file_info.flag & 8) != 0;
3500  if (extlochead) pfile_in_zip_read_info->crcenctest = (char)((s->cur_file_info.dosDate >> 8) & 0xff);
3501  else pfile_in_zip_read_info->crcenctest = (char)(s->cur_file_info.crc >> 24);
3502  pfile_in_zip_read_info->encheadleft = (pfile_in_zip_read_info->encrypted ? 12 : 0);
3503  pfile_in_zip_read_info->keys[0] = 305419896L;
3504  pfile_in_zip_read_info->keys[1] = 591751049L;
3505  pfile_in_zip_read_info->keys[2] = 878082192L;
3506  for (const char *cp = password; cp != 0 && *cp != 0; cp++) Uupdate_keys(pfile_in_zip_read_info->keys, *cp);
3507 
3508  pfile_in_zip_read_info->pos_in_zipfile =
3509  s->cur_file_info_internal.offset_curfile + SIZEZIPLOCALHEADER +
3510  iSizeVar;
3511 
3512  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in = (uInt)0;
3513 
3514  s->pfile_in_zip_read = pfile_in_zip_read_info;
3515 
3516  return UNZ_OK;
3517  }
3518 
3519 
3520  // Read bytes from the current file.
3521  // buf contain buffer where data must be copied
3522  // len the size of buf.
3523  // return the number of byte copied if somes bytes are copied (and also sets *reached_eof)
3524  // return 0 if the end of file was reached. (and also sets *reached_eof).
3525  // return <0 with error code if there is an error. (in which case *reached_eof is meaningless)
3526  // (UNZ_ERRNO for IO error, or zLib error for uncompress error)
3527  inline int unzReadCurrentFile(unzFile file, voidp buf, unsigned len, bool *reached_eof) {
3528  int err = UNZ_OK;
3529  uInt iRead = 0;
3530  if (reached_eof != 0) *reached_eof = false;
3531 
3532  unz_s *s = (unz_s*)file;
3533  if (s == NULL) return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3534 
3535  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read_info = s->pfile_in_zip_read;
3536  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info == NULL) return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3537  if ((pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer == NULL)) return UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE;
3538  if (len == 0) return 0;
3539 
3540  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_out = (Byte*)buf;
3541  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_out = (uInt)len;
3542 
3543  if (len > pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed) {
3544  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_out = (uInt)pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed;
3545  }
3546 
3547  while (pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_out > 0) {
3548  if ((pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in == 0) && (pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_compressed > 0)) {
3549  uInt uReadThis = UNZ_BUFSIZE;
3550  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_compressed < uReadThis) uReadThis = (uInt)pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_compressed;
3551  if (uReadThis == 0) {
3552  if (reached_eof != 0) *reached_eof = true; return UNZ_EOF;
3553  }
3554  if (lufseek(pfile_in_zip_read_info->file, pfile_in_zip_read_info->pos_in_zipfile + pfile_in_zip_read_info->byte_before_the_zipfile, SEEK_SET) != 0) return UNZ_ERRNO;
3555  if (lufread(pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer, uReadThis, 1, pfile_in_zip_read_info->file) != 1) return UNZ_ERRNO;
3556  pfile_in_zip_read_info->pos_in_zipfile += uReadThis;
3557  pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_compressed -= uReadThis;
3558  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_in = (Byte*)pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer;
3559  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in = (uInt)uReadThis;
3560  //
3561  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->encrypted) {
3562  char *buf = (char*)pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_in;
3563  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < uReadThis; i++) buf[i] = zdecode(pfile_in_zip_read_info->keys, buf[i]);
3564  }
3565  }
3566 
3567  unsigned int uDoEncHead = pfile_in_zip_read_info->encheadleft;
3568  if (uDoEncHead > pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in) uDoEncHead = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in;
3569  if (uDoEncHead > 0) {
3570  char bufcrc = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_in[uDoEncHead - 1];
3571  pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed -= uDoEncHead;
3572  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in -= uDoEncHead;
3573  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_in += uDoEncHead;
3574  pfile_in_zip_read_info->encheadleft -= uDoEncHead;
3575  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->encheadleft == 0) {
3576  if (bufcrc != pfile_in_zip_read_info->crcenctest) return UNZ_PASSWORD;
3577  }
3578  }
3579 
3580  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->compression_method == 0) {
3581  uInt uDoCopy, i;
3582  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_out < pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in) {
3583  uDoCopy = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_out;
3584  } else {
3585  uDoCopy = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in;
3586  }
3587  for (i = 0; i < uDoCopy; i++) *(pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_out + i) = *(pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_in + i);
3588  pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32 = ucrc32(pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32, pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_out, uDoCopy);
3589  pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed -= uDoCopy;
3590  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_in -= uDoCopy;
3591  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.avail_out -= uDoCopy;
3592  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_out += uDoCopy;
3593  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_in += uDoCopy;
3594  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.total_out += uDoCopy;
3595  iRead += uDoCopy;
3596  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed == 0) {
3597  if (reached_eof != 0) *reached_eof = true;
3598  }
3599  } else {
3600  uLong uTotalOutBefore, uTotalOutAfter;
3601  const Byte *bufBefore;
3602  uLong uOutThis;
3603  int flush = Z_SYNC_FLUSH;
3604  uTotalOutBefore = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.total_out;
3605  bufBefore = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.next_out;
3606  //
3607  err = inflate(&pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream, flush);
3608  //
3609  uTotalOutAfter = pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.total_out;
3610  uOutThis = uTotalOutAfter - uTotalOutBefore;
3611  pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32 = ucrc32(pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32, bufBefore, (uInt)(uOutThis));
3612  pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed -= uOutThis;
3613  iRead += (uInt)(uTotalOutAfter - uTotalOutBefore);
3614  if (err == Z_STREAM_END || pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed == 0) {
3615  if (reached_eof != 0) *reached_eof = true;
3616  return iRead;
3617  }
3618  if (err != Z_OK) break;
3619  }
3620  }
3621 
3622  if (err == Z_OK) return iRead;
3623  return err;
3624  }
3625 
3626 
3627  // Give the current position in uncompressed data
3628  inline z_off_t unztell(unzFile file) {
3629  unz_s* s;
3630  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read_info;
3631  if (file == NULL)
3632  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3633  s = (unz_s*)file;
3634  pfile_in_zip_read_info = s->pfile_in_zip_read;
3635 
3636  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info == NULL)
3637  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3638 
3639  return (z_off_t)pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream.total_out;
3640  }
3641 
3642 
3643  // return 1 if the end of file was reached, 0 elsewhere
3644  inline int unzeof(unzFile file) {
3645  unz_s* s;
3646  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read_info;
3647  if (file == NULL)
3648  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3649  s = (unz_s*)file;
3650  pfile_in_zip_read_info = s->pfile_in_zip_read;
3651 
3652  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info == NULL)
3653  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3654 
3655  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed == 0)
3656  return 1;
3657  else
3658  return 0;
3659  }
3660 
3661 
3662 
3663  // Read extra field from the current file (opened by unzOpenCurrentFile)
3664  // This is the local-header version of the extra field (sometimes, there is
3665  // more info in the local-header version than in the central-header)
3666  // if buf==NULL, it return the size of the local extra field that can be read
3667  // if buf!=NULL, len is the size of the buffer, the extra header is copied in buf.
3668  // the return value is the number of bytes copied in buf, or (if <0) the error code
3669  inline int unzGetLocalExtrafield(unzFile file, voidp buf, unsigned len) {
3670  unz_s* s;
3671  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read_info;
3672  uInt read_now;
3673  uLong size_to_read;
3674 
3675  if (file == NULL)
3676  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3677  s = (unz_s*)file;
3678  pfile_in_zip_read_info = s->pfile_in_zip_read;
3679 
3680  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info == NULL)
3681  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3682 
3683  size_to_read = (pfile_in_zip_read_info->size_local_extrafield -
3684  pfile_in_zip_read_info->pos_local_extrafield);
3685 
3686  if (buf == NULL)
3687  return (int)size_to_read;
3688 
3689  if (len > size_to_read)
3690  read_now = (uInt)size_to_read;
3691  else
3692  read_now = (uInt)len;
3693 
3694  if (read_now == 0)
3695  return 0;
3696 
3697  if (lufseek(pfile_in_zip_read_info->file, pfile_in_zip_read_info->offset_local_extrafield + pfile_in_zip_read_info->pos_local_extrafield, SEEK_SET) != 0)
3698  return UNZ_ERRNO;
3699 
3700  if (lufread(buf, (uInt)size_to_read, 1, pfile_in_zip_read_info->file) != 1)
3701  return UNZ_ERRNO;
3702 
3703  return (int)read_now;
3704  }
3705 
3706  // Close the file in zip opened with unzipOpenCurrentFile
3707  // Return UNZ_CRCERROR if all the file was read but the CRC is not good
3708  inline int unzCloseCurrentFile(unzFile file) {
3709  int err = UNZ_OK;
3710 
3711  unz_s* s;
3712  file_in_zip_read_info_s* pfile_in_zip_read_info;
3713  if (file == NULL)
3714  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3715  s = (unz_s*)file;
3716  pfile_in_zip_read_info = s->pfile_in_zip_read;
3717 
3718  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info == NULL)
3719  return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3720 
3721 
3722  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->rest_read_uncompressed == 0) {
3723  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32 != pfile_in_zip_read_info->crc32_wait)
3724  err = UNZ_CRCERROR;
3725  }
3726 
3727 
3728  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer != 0) {
3729  void *buf = pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer;
3730  zfree(buf);
3731  pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer = 0;
3732  }
3733  pfile_in_zip_read_info->read_buffer = NULL;
3734  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream_initialised)
3735  inflateEnd(&pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream);
3736 
3737  pfile_in_zip_read_info->stream_initialised = 0;
3738  if (pfile_in_zip_read_info != 0) zfree(pfile_in_zip_read_info); // unused pfile_in_zip_read_info=0;
3739 
3740  s->pfile_in_zip_read = NULL;
3741 
3742  return err;
3743  }
3744 
3745 
3746  // Get the global comment string of the ZipFile, in the szComment buffer.
3747  // uSizeBuf is the size of the szComment buffer.
3748  // return the number of byte copied or an error code <0
3749  inline int unzGetGlobalComment(unzFile file, char *szComment, uLong uSizeBuf) { //int err=UNZ_OK;
3750  unz_s* s;
3751  uLong uReadThis;
3752  if (file == NULL) return UNZ_PARAMERROR;
3753  s = (unz_s*)file;
3754  uReadThis = uSizeBuf;
3755  if (uReadThis > s->gi.size_comment) uReadThis = s->gi.size_comment;
3756  if (lufseek(s->file, s->central_pos + 22, SEEK_SET) != 0) return UNZ_ERRNO;
3757  if (uReadThis > 0) {
3758  *szComment = '\0';
3759  if (lufread(szComment, (uInt)uReadThis, 1, s->file) != 1) return UNZ_ERRNO;
3760  }
3761  if ((szComment != NULL) && (uSizeBuf > s->gi.size_comment)) *(szComment + s->gi.size_comment) = '\0';
3762  return (int)uReadThis;
3763  }
3764 
3765 
3766 
3767 
3768 
3769  inline int unzOpenCurrentFile(unzFile file, const char *password);
3770  inline int unzReadCurrentFile(unzFile file, void *buf, unsigned len);
3771  inline int unzCloseCurrentFile(unzFile file);
3772 
3773 
3774 
3775 
3776  class TUnzip {
3777  public:
3778  TUnzip(const char *pwd) : uf(0), unzbuf(0), currentfile(-1), czei(-1), password(0) {
3779  if (pwd != 0) {
3780  password = new char[strlen(pwd) + 1];
3781 #ifdef _MSC_VER
3782  strcpy_s(password, strlen(pwd) + 1, pwd);
3783 #elif __GNUC__
3784  strcpy(password, pwd);
3785 #endif
3786  }
3787  }
3788  ~TUnzip() {
3789  if (password != 0) delete[] password; password = 0; if (unzbuf != 0) delete[] unzbuf; unzbuf = 0;
3790  }
3791 
3792  unzFile uf; int currentfile; ZIPENTRY cze; int czei;
3793  char *password;
3794  char *unzbuf; // lazily created and destroyed, used by Unzip
3795  TCHAR rootdir[MAX_PATH]; // includes a trailing slash
3796 
3797  inline ZRESULT Open(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags);
3798  inline ZRESULT Get(int index, ZIPENTRY *ze);
3799  inline ZRESULT Find(const TCHAR *name, bool ic, int *index, ZIPENTRY *ze);
3800  inline ZRESULT Unzip(int index, void *dst, unsigned int len, DWORD flags);
3801  inline ZRESULT SetUnzipBaseDir(const TCHAR *dir);
3802  inline ZRESULT Close();
3803  };
3804 
3805 
3806  inline ZRESULT TUnzip::Open(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags) {
3807  if (uf != 0 || currentfile != -1) return ZR_NOTINITED;
3808  //
3809 
3810 #ifdef GetCurrentDirectory
3811  GetCurrentDirectory(MAX_PATH - 1, rootdir);
3812 #else
3813  rootdir[0] = '/'; rootdir[1] = 0;
3814 #endif
3815  TCHAR *lastchar = &rootdir[_tcslen(rootdir) - 1];
3816  if (*lastchar != '\\' && *lastchar != '/') {
3817  lastchar[1] = '/'; lastchar[2] = 0;
3818  }
3819  //
3820  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE) { // test if we can seek on it. We can't use GetFileType(h)==FILE_TYPE_DISK since it's not on CE.
3821  DWORD res = GetFilePosU((HANDLE)z);
3822  bool canseek = (res != 0xFFFFFFFF);
3823  if (!canseek) return ZR_SEEK;
3824  }
3825  ZRESULT e; LUFILE *f = lufopen(z, len, flags, &e);
3826  if (f == NULL) return e;
3827  uf = unzOpenInternal(f);
3828  if (uf == 0) return ZR_NOFILE;
3829  return ZR_OK;
3830  }
3831 
3832  inline ZRESULT TUnzip::SetUnzipBaseDir(const TCHAR *dir) {
3833 
3834  _tcsncpy_s(rootdir, 260, dir, MAX_PATH - 1);
3835 
3836  TCHAR *lastchar = &rootdir[_tcslen(rootdir) - 1];
3837  if (*lastchar != '\\' && *lastchar != '/') {
3838  lastchar[1] = '/'; lastchar[2] = 0;
3839  }
3840  return ZR_OK;
3841  }
3842 
3843  inline ZRESULT TUnzip::Get(int index, ZIPENTRY *ze) {
3844  if (index < -1 || index >= (int)uf->gi.number_entry) return ZR_ARGS;
3845  if (currentfile != -1) unzCloseCurrentFile(uf); currentfile = -1;
3846  if (index == czei && index != -1) {
3847  memcpy(ze, &cze, sizeof(ZIPENTRY)); return ZR_OK;
3848  }
3849  if (index == -1) {
3850  ze->index = uf->gi.number_entry;
3851  ze->name[0] = 0;
3852  ze->attr = 0;
3853 
3854  ze->atime.dwLowDateTime = 0; ze->atime.dwHighDateTime = 0;
3855  ze->ctime.dwLowDateTime = 0; ze->ctime.dwHighDateTime = 0;
3856  ze->mtime.dwLowDateTime = 0; ze->mtime.dwHighDateTime = 0;
3857 
3858  ze->comp_size = 0;
3859  ze->unc_size = 0;
3860  return ZR_OK;
3861  }
3862  if (index < (int)uf->num_file) unzGoToFirstFile(uf);
3863  while ((int)uf->num_file < index) unzGoToNextFile(uf);
3864  unz_file_info ufi; char fn[MAX_PATH];
3865  unzGetCurrentFileInfo(uf, &ufi, fn, MAX_PATH, NULL, 0, NULL, 0);
3866  // now get the extra header. We do this ourselves, instead of
3867  // calling unzOpenCurrentFile &c., to avoid allocating more than necessary.
3868  unsigned int extralen, iSizeVar; unsigned long offset;
3869  int res = unzlocal_CheckCurrentFileCoherencyHeader(uf, &iSizeVar, &offset, &extralen);
3870  if (res != UNZ_OK) return ZR_CORRUPT;
3871  if (lufseek(uf->file, offset, SEEK_SET) != 0) return ZR_READ;
3872  unsigned char *extra = new unsigned char[extralen];
3873  if (lufread(extra, 1, (uInt)extralen, uf->file) != extralen) {
3874  delete[] extra; return ZR_READ;
3875  }
3876  //
3877  ze->index = uf->num_file;
3878  TCHAR tfn[MAX_PATH];
3879 #ifdef UNICODE
3880  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, fn, -1, tfn, MAX_PATH);
3881 #else
3882  strcpy(tfn, fn);
3883 #endif
3884  // As a safety feature: if the zip filename had sneaky stuff
3885  // like "c:\windows\file.txt" or "\windows\file.txt" or "fred\..\..\..\windows\file.txt"
3886  // then we get rid of them all. That way, when the programmer does UnzipItem(hz,i,ze.name),
3887  // it won't be a problem. (If the programmer really did want to get the full evil information,
3888  // then they can edit out this security feature from here).
3889  // In particular, we chop off any prefixes that are "c:\" or "\" or "/" or "[stuff]\.." or "[stuff]/.."
3890  const TCHAR *sfn = tfn;
3891  for (;;) {
3892  if (sfn[0] != 0 && sfn[1] == ':') {
3893  sfn += 2; continue;
3894  }
3895  if (sfn[0] == '\\') {
3896  sfn++; continue;
3897  }
3898  if (sfn[0] == '/') {
3899  sfn++; continue;
3900  }
3901  const TCHAR *c;
3902  c = _tcsstr(sfn, _T("\\..\\")); if (c != 0) {
3903  sfn = c + 4; continue;
3904  }
3905  c = _tcsstr(sfn, _T("\\../")); if (c != 0) {
3906  sfn = c + 4; continue;
3907  }
3908  c = _tcsstr(sfn, _T("/../")); if (c != 0) {
3909  sfn = c + 4; continue;
3910  }
3911  c = _tcsstr(sfn, _T("/..\\")); if (c != 0) {
3912  sfn = c + 4; continue;
3913  }
3914  break;
3915  }
3916  _tcsncpy_s(ze->name, 260, sfn, MAX_PATH);
3917 
3918 
3919  unsigned long a = ufi.external_fa;
3920  // zip has an 'attribute' 32bit value. Its lower half is windows stuff
3921  // its upper half is standard unix stat.st_mode. We'll start trying
3922  // to read it in unix mode
3923  bool isdir = (a & 0x40000000) != 0;
3924  bool readonly = (a & 0x00800000) == 0;
3925  //bool readable= (a&0x01000000)!=0; // unused
3926  //bool executable=(a&0x00400000)!=0; // unused
3927  bool hidden = false, system = false, archive = true;
3928  // but in normal hostmodes these are overridden by the lower half...
3929  int host = ufi.version >> 8;
3930  if (host == 0 || host == 7 || host == 11 || host == 14) {
3931  readonly = (a & 0x00000001) != 0;
3932  hidden = (a & 0x00000002) != 0;
3933  system = (a & 0x00000004) != 0;
3934  isdir = (a & 0x00000010) != 0;
3935  archive = (a & 0x00000020) != 0;
3936  }
3937  readonly; hidden; system; isdir; archive;
3938  ze->attr = 0;
3939 
3940  if (isdir) ze->attr |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY;
3941  if (archive) ze->attr |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE;
3942  if (hidden) ze->attr |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN;
3943  if (readonly) ze->attr |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY;
3944  if (system) ze->attr |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM;
3945 
3946  ze->comp_size = ufi.compressed_size;
3947  ze->unc_size = ufi.uncompressed_size;
3948  //
3949  WORD dostime = (WORD)(ufi.dosDate & 0xFFFF);
3950  WORD dosdate = (WORD)((ufi.dosDate >> 16) & 0xFFFF);
3951  FILETIME ftd = dosdatetime2filetime(dosdate, dostime);
3952  FILETIME ft; LocalFileTimeToFileTime(&ftd, &ft);
3953  ze->atime = ft; ze->ctime = ft; ze->mtime = ft;
3954  // the zip will always have at least that dostime. But if it also has
3955  // an extra header, then we'll instead get the info from that.
3956  unsigned int epos = 0;
3957  while (epos + 4 < extralen) {
3958  char etype[3]; etype[0] = extra[epos + 0]; etype[1] = extra[epos + 1]; etype[2] = 0;
3959  int size = extra[epos + 2];
3960  if (strcmp(etype, "UT") != 0) {
3961  epos += 4 + size; continue;
3962  }
3963  int flags = extra[epos + 4];
3964  bool hasmtime = (flags & 1) != 0;
3965  bool hasatime = (flags & 2) != 0;
3966  bool hasctime = (flags & 4) != 0;
3967  epos += 5;
3968  if (hasmtime) {
3969  lutime_t mtime = ((extra[epos + 0]) << 0) | ((extra[epos + 1]) << 8) | ((extra[epos + 2]) << 16) | ((extra[epos + 3]) << 24);
3970  epos += 4;
3971  ze->mtime = timet2filetime(mtime);
3972  }
3973  if (hasatime) {
3974  lutime_t atime = ((extra[epos + 0]) << 0) | ((extra[epos + 1]) << 8) | ((extra[epos + 2]) << 16) | ((extra[epos + 3]) << 24);
3975  epos += 4;
3976  ze->atime = timet2filetime(atime);
3977  }
3978  if (hasctime) {
3979  lutime_t ctime = ((extra[epos + 0]) << 0) | ((extra[epos + 1]) << 8) | ((extra[epos + 2]) << 16) | ((extra[epos + 3]) << 24);
3980  epos += 4;
3981  ze->ctime = timet2filetime(ctime);
3982  }
3983  break;
3984  }
3985  //
3986  if (extra != 0) delete[] extra;
3987  memcpy(&cze, ze, sizeof(ZIPENTRY)); czei = index;
3988  return ZR_OK;
3989  }
3990 
3991  inline ZRESULT TUnzip::Find(const TCHAR *tname, bool ic, int *index, ZIPENTRY *ze) {
3992  char name[MAX_PATH];
3993 #ifdef UNICODE
3994  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, tname, -1, name, MAX_PATH, 0, 0);
3995 #else
3996  strcpy(name, tname);
3997 #endif
3998  int res = unzLocateFile(uf, name, ic ? CASE_INSENSITIVE : CASE_SENSITIVE);
3999  if (res != UNZ_OK) {
4000  if (index != 0) *index = -1;
4001  if (ze != NULL) {
4002  memset(ze, 0, sizeof(ZIPENTRY)); ze->index = -1;
4003  }
4004  return ZR_NOTFOUND;
4005  }
4006  if (currentfile != -1) unzCloseCurrentFile(uf); currentfile = -1;
4007  int i = (int)uf->num_file;
4008  if (index != NULL) *index = i;
4009  if (ze != NULL) {
4010  ZRESULT zres = Get(i, ze);
4011  if (zres != ZR_OK) return zres;
4012  }
4013  return ZR_OK;
4014  }
4015 
4016  inline void EnsureDirectory(const TCHAR *rootdir, const TCHAR *dir) { // first check that rootdir exists. nb. rootdir has a trailing slash
4017  if (rootdir != 0) {
4018  TCHAR rd[MAX_PATH]; _tcsncpy_s(rd, 260, rootdir, MAX_PATH); size_t len = _tcslen(rd);
4019  if (len > 0 && (rd[len - 1] == '/' || rd[len - 1] == '\\')) rd[len - 1] = 0;
4020  if (!FileExists(rd)) CreateDirectory(rd, 0);
4021  }
4022  if (*dir == 0) return;
4023  const TCHAR *lastslash = dir, *c = lastslash;
4024  while (*c != 0) {
4025  if (*c == '/' || *c == '\\') lastslash = c; c++;
4026  }
4027  const TCHAR *name = lastslash;
4028  if (lastslash != dir) {
4029  TCHAR tmp[MAX_PATH]; memcpy(tmp, dir, sizeof(TCHAR)*(lastslash - dir));
4030  tmp[lastslash - dir] = 0;
4031  EnsureDirectory(rootdir, tmp);
4032  name++;
4033  }
4034  TCHAR cd[MAX_PATH]; *cd = 0; if (rootdir != 0) _tcsncpy_s(cd, 260, rootdir, MAX_PATH); cd[MAX_PATH - 1] = 0;
4035  size_t len = _tcslen(cd); _tcsncpy_s(cd + len, 260 - len, dir, MAX_PATH - len); cd[MAX_PATH - 1] = 0;
4036 
4037  if (!FileExists(cd)) {
4038  CreateDirectory(cd, 0);
4039  }
4040  }
4041 
4042 
4043 
4044  inline ZRESULT TUnzip::Unzip(int index, void *dst, unsigned int len, DWORD flags) {
4045  if (flags != ZIP_MEMORY && flags != ZIP_FILENAME && flags != ZIP_HANDLE) return ZR_ARGS;
4046  if (flags == ZIP_MEMORY) {
4047  if (index != currentfile) {
4048  if (currentfile != -1) unzCloseCurrentFile(uf); currentfile = -1;
4049  if (index >= (int)uf->gi.number_entry) return ZR_ARGS;
4050  if (index < (int)uf->num_file) unzGoToFirstFile(uf);
4051  while ((int)uf->num_file < index) unzGoToNextFile(uf);
4052  unzOpenCurrentFile(uf, password); currentfile = index;
4053  }
4054  bool reached_eof;
4055  int res = unzReadCurrentFile(uf, dst, len, &reached_eof);
4056  if (res <= 0) {
4057  unzCloseCurrentFile(uf); currentfile = -1;
4058  }
4059  if (reached_eof) return ZR_OK;
4060  if (res > 0) return ZR_MORE;
4061  if (res == UNZ_PASSWORD) return ZR_PASSWORD;
4062  return ZR_FLATE;
4063  }
4064  // otherwise we're writing to a handle or a file
4065  if (currentfile != -1) unzCloseCurrentFile(uf); currentfile = -1;
4066  if (index >= (int)uf->gi.number_entry) return ZR_ARGS;
4067  if (index < (int)uf->num_file) unzGoToFirstFile(uf);
4068  while ((int)uf->num_file < index) unzGoToNextFile(uf);
4069  ZIPENTRY ze; Get(index, &ze);
4070  // zipentry=directory is handled specially
4071  bool isdir = (ze.attr&FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) != 0;
4072  if (isdir) {
4073  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE) return ZR_OK; // don't do anything
4074  const TCHAR *dir = (const TCHAR*)dst;
4075  bool isabsolute = (dir[0] == '/' || dir[0] == '\\' || (dir[0] != 0 && dir[1] == ':'));
4076  if (isabsolute) EnsureDirectory(0, dir); else EnsureDirectory(rootdir, dir);
4077  return ZR_OK;
4078  }
4079  // otherwise, we write the zipentry to a file/handle
4080  HANDLE h; TCHAR fn[MAX_PATH]; fn[0] = 0;
4081  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE) h = (HANDLE)dst;
4082  else {
4083  const TCHAR *ufn = (const TCHAR*)dst;
4084  // We'll qualify all relative names to our root dir, and leave absolute names as they are
4085  // ufn="zipfile.txt" dir="" name="zipfile.txt" fn="c:\\currentdir\\zipfile.txt"
4086  // ufn="dir1/dir2/subfile.txt" dir="dir1/dir2/" name="subfile.txt" fn="c:\\currentdir\\dir1/dir2/subfiles.txt"
4087  // ufn="\z\file.txt" dir="\z\" name="file.txt" fn="\z\file.txt"
4088  // This might be a security risk, in the case where we just use the zipentry's name as "ufn", where
4089  // a malicious zip could unzip itself into c:\windows. Our solution is that GetZipItem (which
4090  // is how the user retrieve's the file's name within the zip) never returns absolute paths.
4091  const TCHAR *name = ufn; const TCHAR *c = name; while (*c != 0) {
4092  if (*c == '/' || *c == '\\') name = c + 1; c++;
4093  }
4094  TCHAR dir[MAX_PATH]; _tcsncpy_s(dir, 260, ufn, MAX_PATH); if (name == ufn) *dir = 0; else dir[name - ufn] = 0;
4095  bool isabsolute = (dir[0] == '/' || dir[0] == '\\' || (dir[0] != 0 && dir[1] == ':'));
4096  if (isabsolute) {
4097 #ifdef _UNICODE
4098  std::wostringstream oss;
4099 #else
4100  std::ostringstream oss;
4101 #endif
4102  oss << dir << name;
4103  _tcscpy_s(fn, 260, oss.str().c_str());
4104  //_tsprintf(fn,_T("%s%s"),dir,name);
4105  EnsureDirectory(0, dir);
4106  } else {
4107 #ifdef _UNICODE
4108  std::wostringstream oss;
4109 #else
4110  std::ostringstream oss;
4111 #endif
4112  oss << rootdir << dir << name;
4113  _tcscpy_s(fn, 260, oss.str().c_str());
4114  //_tsprintf(fn,_T("%s%s%s"),rootdir,dir,name);
4115  EnsureDirectory(rootdir, dir);
4116  }
4117  //
4118  h = CreateFile(fn, GENERIC_WRITE, 0, NULL, CREATE_ALWAYS, ze.attr, NULL);
4119  }
4120  if (h == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return ZR_NOFILE;
4121  unzOpenCurrentFile(uf, password);
4122  if (unzbuf == 0) unzbuf = new char[16384]; DWORD haderr = 0;
4123  //
4124 
4125  for (; haderr == 0;) {
4126  bool reached_eof;
4127  int res = unzReadCurrentFile(uf, unzbuf, 16384, &reached_eof);
4128  if (res == UNZ_PASSWORD) {
4129  haderr = ZR_PASSWORD; break;
4130  }
4131  if (res < 0) {
4132  haderr = ZR_FLATE; break;
4133  }
4134  if (res > 0) {
4135  DWORD writ; BOOL bres = WriteFile(h, unzbuf, res, &writ, NULL); if (!bres) {
4136  haderr = ZR_WRITE; break;
4137  }
4138  }
4139 
4140  if (reached_eof) break;
4141  if (res == 0) {
4142  haderr = ZR_FLATE; break;
4143  }
4144  }
4145  unzCloseCurrentFile(uf);
4146  if (!haderr) SetFileTime(h, &ze.ctime, &ze.atime, &ze.mtime); // may fail if it was a pipe
4147  if (flags != ZIP_HANDLE) CloseHandle(h);
4148  if (haderr != 0) return haderr;
4149  return ZR_OK;
4150  }
4151 
4152  inline ZRESULT TUnzip::Close() {
4153  if (currentfile != -1) unzCloseCurrentFile(uf); currentfile = -1;
4154  if (uf != 0) unzClose(uf); uf = 0;
4155  return ZR_OK;
4156  }
4157 
4158 
4159 
4160 
4161 
4162  __declspec(selectany) ZRESULT lasterrorU = ZR_OK;
4163 
4164  inline unsigned int FormatZipMessageU(ZRESULT code, TCHAR *buf, unsigned int len) {
4165  if (code == ZR_RECENT) code = lasterrorU;
4166  const TCHAR *msg = _T("unknown zip result code");
4167  switch (code) {
4168  case ZR_OK: msg = _T("Success"); break;
4169  case ZR_NODUPH: msg = _T("Culdn't duplicate handle"); break;
4170  case ZR_NOFILE: msg = _T("Couldn't create/open file"); break;
4171  case ZR_NOALLOC: msg = _T("Failed to allocate memory"); break;
4172  case ZR_WRITE: msg = _T("Error writing to file"); break;
4173  case ZR_NOTFOUND: msg = _T("File not found in the zipfile"); break;
4174  case ZR_MORE: msg = _T("Still more data to unzip"); break;
4175  case ZR_CORRUPT: msg = _T("Zipfile is corrupt or not a zipfile"); break;
4176  case ZR_READ: msg = _T("Error reading file"); break;
4177  case ZR_PASSWORD: msg = _T("Correct password required"); break;
4178  case ZR_ARGS: msg = _T("Caller: faulty arguments"); break;
4179  case ZR_PARTIALUNZ: msg = _T("Caller: the file had already been partially unzipped"); break;
4180  case ZR_NOTMMAP: msg = _T("Caller: can only get memory of a memory zipfile"); break;
4181  case ZR_MEMSIZE: msg = _T("Caller: not enough space allocated for memory zipfile"); break;
4182  case ZR_FAILED: msg = _T("Caller: there was a previous error"); break;
4183  case ZR_ENDED: msg = _T("Caller: additions to the zip have already been ended"); break;
4184  case ZR_ZMODE: msg = _T("Caller: mixing creation and opening of zip"); break;
4185  case ZR_NOTINITED: msg = _T("Zip-bug: internal initialisation not completed"); break;
4186  case ZR_SEEK: msg = _T("Zip-bug: trying to seek the unseekable"); break;
4187  case ZR_MISSIZE: msg = _T("Zip-bug: the anticipated size turned out wrong"); break;
4188  case ZR_NOCHANGE: msg = _T("Zip-bug: tried to change mind, but not allowed"); break;
4189  case ZR_FLATE: msg = _T("Zip-bug: an internal error during flation"); break;
4190  }
4191  unsigned int mlen = (unsigned int)_tcslen(msg);
4192  if (buf == 0 || len == 0) return mlen;
4193  unsigned int n = mlen; if (n + 1 > len) n = len - 1;
4194  //_tcsncpy_s(buf,msg,n);
4195  memcpy(buf, msg, n);
4196  buf[n] = 0;
4197  return mlen;
4198  }
4199 
4200 
4201  typedef struct {
4202  DWORD flag;
4203  TUnzip *unz;
4204  } TUnzipHandleData;
4205 
4206  inline HZIP OpenZipInternal(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags, const char *password) {
4207  TUnzip *unz = new TUnzip(password);
4208  lasterrorU = unz->Open(z, len, flags);
4209  if (lasterrorU != ZR_OK) {
4210  delete unz; return 0;
4211  }
4212  TUnzipHandleData *han = new TUnzipHandleData;
4213  han->flag = 1; han->unz = unz; return (HZIP)han;
4214  }
4215  inline HZIP OpenZipHandle(HANDLE h, const char *password) {
4216  return OpenZipInternal((void*)h, 0, ZIP_HANDLE, password);
4217  }
4218  inline HZIP OpenZip(const TCHAR *fn, const char *password) {
4219  return OpenZipInternal((void*)fn, 0, ZIP_FILENAME, password);
4220  }
4221  inline HZIP OpenZip(void *z, unsigned int len, const char *password) {
4222  return OpenZipInternal(z, len, ZIP_MEMORY, password);
4223  }
4224 
4225 
4226  inline ZRESULT GetZipItem(HZIP hz, int index, ZIPENTRY *ze) {
4227  ze->index = 0; *ze->name = 0; ze->unc_size = 0;
4228  if (hz == 0) {
4229  lasterrorU = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
4230  }
4231  TUnzipHandleData *han = (TUnzipHandleData*)hz;
4232  if (han->flag != 1) {
4233  lasterrorU = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
4234  }
4235  TUnzip *unz = han->unz;
4236  lasterrorU = unz->Get(index, ze);
4237  return lasterrorU;
4238  }
4239 
4240  inline ZRESULT FindZipItem(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *name, bool ic, int *index, ZIPENTRY *ze) {
4241  if (hz == 0) {
4242  lasterrorU = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
4243  }
4244  TUnzipHandleData *han = (TUnzipHandleData*)hz;
4245  if (han->flag != 1) {
4246  lasterrorU = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
4247  }
4248  TUnzip *unz = han->unz;
4249  lasterrorU = unz->Find(name, ic, index, ze);
4250  return lasterrorU;
4251  }
4252 
4253  inline ZRESULT UnzipItemInternal(HZIP hz, int index, void *dst, unsigned int len, DWORD flags) {
4254  if (hz == 0) {
4255  lasterrorU = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
4256  }
4257  TUnzipHandleData *han = (TUnzipHandleData*)hz;
4258  if (han->flag != 1) {
4259  lasterrorU = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
4260  }
4261  TUnzip *unz = han->unz;
4262  lasterrorU = unz->Unzip(index, dst, len, flags);
4263  return lasterrorU;
4264  }
4265  inline ZRESULT UnzipItemHandle(HZIP hz, int index, HANDLE h) {
4266  return UnzipItemInternal(hz, index, (void*)h, 0, ZIP_HANDLE);
4267  }
4268  inline ZRESULT UnzipItem(HZIP hz, int index, const TCHAR *fn) {
4269  return UnzipItemInternal(hz, index, (void*)fn, 0, ZIP_FILENAME);
4270  }
4271  inline ZRESULT UnzipItem(HZIP hz, int index, void *z, unsigned int len) {
4272  return UnzipItemInternal(hz, index, z, len, ZIP_MEMORY);
4273  }
4274 
4275  inline ZRESULT SetUnzipBaseDir(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dir) {
4276  if (hz == 0) {
4277  lasterrorU = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
4278  }
4279  TUnzipHandleData *han = (TUnzipHandleData*)hz;
4280  if (han->flag != 1) {
4281  lasterrorU = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
4282  }
4283  TUnzip *unz = han->unz;
4284  lasterrorU = unz->SetUnzipBaseDir(dir);
4285  return lasterrorU;
4286  }
4287 
4288 
4289  inline ZRESULT CloseZipU(HZIP hz) {
4290  if (hz == 0) {
4291  lasterrorU = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
4292  }
4293  TUnzipHandleData *han = (TUnzipHandleData*)hz;
4294  if (han->flag != 1) {
4295  lasterrorU = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
4296  }
4297  TUnzip *unz = han->unz;
4298  lasterrorU = unz->Close();
4299  delete unz;
4300  delete han;
4301  return lasterrorU;
4302  }
4303 
4304  inline bool IsZipHandleU(HZIP hz) {
4305  if (hz == 0) return false;
4306  TUnzipHandleData *han = (TUnzipHandleData*)hz;
4307  return (han->flag == 1);
4308  }
4309 }
4310 //Zip part
4311 namespace ispring_3rdparty {
4312 #ifndef _zip_H
4313 #define _zip_H
4314  // THIS FILE is almost entirely based upon code by info-zip.
4315  // It has been modified by Lucian Wischik. The modifications
4316  // were a complete rewrite of the bit of code that generates the
4317  // layout of the zipfile, and support for zipping to/from memory
4318  // or handles or pipes or pagefile or diskfiles, encryption, unicode.
4319  // The original code may be found at http://www.info-zip.org
4320  // The original copyright text follows.
4321  //
4322  //
4323  //
4324  // This is version 1999-Oct-05 of the Info-ZIP copyright and license.
4325  // The definitive version of this document should be available at
4326  // ftp://ftp.cdrom.com/pub/infozip/license.html indefinitely.
4327  //
4328  // Copyright (c) 1990-1999 Info-ZIP. All rights reserved.
4329  //
4330  // For the purposes of this copyright and license, "Info-ZIP" is defined as
4331  // the following set of individuals:
4332  //

4334  // Jean-loup Gailly, Hunter Goatley, Ian Gorman, Chris Herborth, Dirk Haase,
4335  // Greg Hartwig, Robert Heath, Jonathan Hudson, Paul Kienitz, David Kirschbaum,
4336  // Johnny Lee, Onno van der Linden, Igor Mandrichenko, Steve P. Miller,
4337  // Sergio Monesi, Keith Owens, George Petrov, Greg Roelofs, Kai Uwe Rommel,
4338  // Steve Salisbury, Dave Smith, Christian Spieler, Antoine Verheijen,
4339  // Paul von Behren, Rich Wales, Mike White
4340  //
4341  // This software is provided "as is," without warranty of any kind, express
4342  // or implied. In no event shall Info-ZIP or its contributors be held liable
4343  // for any direct, indirect, incidental, special or consequential damages
4344  // arising out of the use of or inability to use this software.
4345  //
4346  // Permission is granted to anyone to use this software for any purpose,
4347  // including commercial applications, and to alter it and redistribute it
4348  // freely, subject to the following restrictions:
4349  //

4351  // definition, disclaimer, and this list of conditions.
4352  //

4354  // notice, definition, disclaimer, and this list of conditions in
4355  // documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
4356  //

4358  // systems, existing ports with new graphical interfaces, and dynamic,
4359  // shared, or static library versions--must be plainly marked as such
4360  // and must not be misrepresented as being the original source. Such
4361  // altered versions also must not be misrepresented as being Info-ZIP

4363  // versions with the names "Info-ZIP" (or any variation thereof, including,
4364  // but not limited to, different capitalizations), "Pocket UnZip," "WiZ"
4365  // or "MacZip" without the explicit permission of Info-ZIP. Such altered
4366  // versions are further prohibited from misrepresentative use of the
4367  // Zip-Bugs or Info-ZIP e-mail addresses or of the Info-ZIP URL(s).
4368  //

4370  // "WiZ," "Pocket UnZip," "Pocket Zip," and "MacZip" for its own source and
4371  // binary releases.

4373 #ifndef _unzip_H
4374  DECLARE_HANDLE(HZIP);
4375 #endif
4376 
4377  typedef DWORD ZRESULT;
4378 
4379 
4380 
4381  inline HZIP CreateZip(const TCHAR *fn, const char *password);
4382  inline HZIP CreateZip(void *buf, unsigned int len, const char *password);
4383  inline HZIP CreateZipHandle(HANDLE h, const char *password);
4384 
4385 
4386  inline ZRESULT ZipAdd(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, const TCHAR *fn);
4387  inline ZRESULT ZipAdd(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, void *src, unsigned int len);
4388  inline ZRESULT ZipAddHandle(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, HANDLE h);
4389  inline ZRESULT ZipAddHandle(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, HANDLE h, unsigned int len);
4390  inline ZRESULT ZipAddFolder(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn);
