6238  if (state.ds.lookahead < MIN_LOOKAHEAD) fill_window(state);
6239  }
6240  if (match_available) ct_tally(state, 0, state.ds.window[state.ds.strstart - 1]);
6241 
6242  return FLUSH_BLOCK(state, 1); /* eof */
6243  }
6244 
6245 
6246 
6247 
6248 
6249 
6250 
6251 
6252 
6253 
6254 
6255 
6256  inline int putlocal(struct zlist *z, WRITEFUNC wfunc, void *param) { // Write a local header described by *z to file *f. Return a ZE_ error code.
6257  PUTLG(LOCSIG, f);
6258  PUTSH(z->ver, f);
6259  PUTSH(z->lflg, f);
6260  PUTSH(z->how, f);
6261  PUTLG(z->tim, f);
6262  PUTLG(z->crc, f);
6263  PUTLG(z->siz, f);
6264  PUTLG(z->len, f);
6265  PUTSH(z->nam, f);
6266  PUTSH(z->ext, f);
6267  size_t res = (size_t)wfunc(param, z->iname, (unsigned int)z->nam);
6268  if (res != z->nam) return ZE_TEMP;
6269  if (z->ext) {
6270  res = (size_t)wfunc(param, z->extra, (unsigned int)z->ext);
6271  if (res != z->ext) return ZE_TEMP;
6272  }
6273  return ZE_OK;
6274  }
6275 
6276  inline int putextended(struct zlist *z, WRITEFUNC wfunc, void *param) { // Write an extended local header described by *z to file *f. Returns a ZE_ code
6277  PUTLG(EXTLOCSIG, f);
6278  PUTLG(z->crc, f);
6279  PUTLG(z->siz, f);
6280  PUTLG(z->len, f);
6281  return ZE_OK;
6282  }
6283 
6284  inline int putcentral(struct zlist *z, WRITEFUNC wfunc, void *param) { // Write a central header entry of *z to file *f. Returns a ZE_ code.
6285  PUTLG(CENSIG, f);
6286  PUTSH(z->vem, f);
6287  PUTSH(z->ver, f);
6288  PUTSH(z->flg, f);
6289  PUTSH(z->how, f);
6290  PUTLG(z->tim, f);
6291  PUTLG(z->crc, f);
6292  PUTLG(z->siz, f);
6293  PUTLG(z->len, f);
6294  PUTSH(z->nam, f);
6295  PUTSH(z->cext, f);
6296  PUTSH(z->com, f);
6297  PUTSH(z->dsk, f);
6298  PUTSH(z->att, f);
6299  PUTLG(z->atx, f);
6300  PUTLG(z->off, f);
6301  if ((size_t)wfunc(param, z->iname, (unsigned int)z->nam) != z->nam ||
6302  (z->cext && (size_t)wfunc(param, z->cextra, (unsigned int)z->cext) != z->cext) ||
6303  (z->com && (size_t)wfunc(param, z->comment, (unsigned int)z->com) != z->com))
6304  return ZE_TEMP;
6305  return ZE_OK;
6306  }
6307 
6308 
6309  inline int putend(int n, ulg s, ulg c, extent m, char *z, WRITEFUNC wfunc, void *param) { // write the end of the central-directory-data to file *f.
6310  PUTLG(ENDSIG, f);
6311  PUTSH(0, f);
6312  PUTSH(0, f);
6313  PUTSH(n, f);
6314  PUTSH(n, f);
6315  PUTLG(s, f);
6316  PUTLG(c, f);
6317  PUTSH(m, f);
6318  // Write the comment, if any
6319  if (m && wfunc(param, z, (unsigned int)m) != m) return ZE_TEMP;
6320  return ZE_OK;
6321  }
6322 
6323 
6324 
6325 
6326 
6327 #ifndef _unzip_H
6328  const ulg crc_table[256] = {
6329  0x00000000L, 0x77073096L, 0xee0e612cL, 0x990951baL, 0x076dc419L,
6330  0x706af48fL, 0xe963a535L, 0x9e6495a3L, 0x0edb8832L, 0x79dcb8a4L,
6331  0xe0d5e91eL, 0x97d2d988L, 0x09b64c2bL, 0x7eb17cbdL, 0xe7b82d07L,
6332  0x90bf1d91L, 0x1db71064L, 0x6ab020f2L, 0xf3b97148L, 0x84be41deL,
6333  0x1adad47dL, 0x6ddde4ebL, 0xf4d4b551L, 0x83d385c7L, 0x136c9856L,
6334  0x646ba8c0L, 0xfd62f97aL, 0x8a65c9ecL, 0x14015c4fL, 0x63066cd9L,
6335  0xfa0f3d63L, 0x8d080df5L, 0x3b6e20c8L, 0x4c69105eL, 0xd56041e4L,
6336  0xa2677172L, 0x3c03e4d1L, 0x4b04d447L, 0xd20d85fdL, 0xa50ab56bL,
6337  0x35b5a8faL, 0x42b2986cL, 0xdbbbc9d6L, 0xacbcf940L, 0x32d86ce3L,
6338  0x45df5c75L, 0xdcd60dcfL, 0xabd13d59L, 0x26d930acL, 0x51de003aL,
6339  0xc8d75180L, 0xbfd06116L, 0x21b4f4b5L, 0x56b3c423L, 0xcfba9599L,
6340  0xb8bda50fL, 0x2802b89eL, 0x5f058808L, 0xc60cd9b2L, 0xb10be924L,
6341  0x2f6f7c87L, 0x58684c11L, 0xc1611dabL, 0xb6662d3dL, 0x76dc4190L,
6342  0x01db7106L, 0x98d220bcL, 0xefd5102aL, 0x71b18589L, 0x06b6b51fL,
6343  0x9fbfe4a5L, 0xe8b8d433L, 0x7807c9a2L, 0x0f00f934L, 0x9609a88eL,
6344  0xe10e9818L, 0x7f6a0dbbL, 0x086d3d2dL, 0x91646c97L, 0xe6635c01L,
6345  0x6b6b51f4L, 0x1c6c6162L, 0x856530d8L, 0xf262004eL, 0x6c0695edL,
6346  0x1b01a57bL, 0x8208f4c1L, 0xf50fc457L, 0x65b0d9c6L, 0x12b7e950L,
6347  0x8bbeb8eaL, 0xfcb9887cL, 0x62dd1ddfL, 0x15da2d49L, 0x8cd37cf3L,
6348  0xfbd44c65L, 0x4db26158L, 0x3ab551ceL, 0xa3bc0074L, 0xd4bb30e2L,
6349  0x4adfa541L, 0x3dd895d7L, 0xa4d1c46dL, 0xd3d6f4fbL, 0x4369e96aL,
6350  0x346ed9fcL, 0xad678846L, 0xda60b8d0L, 0x44042d73L, 0x33031de5L,
6351  0xaa0a4c5fL, 0xdd0d7cc9L, 0x5005713cL, 0x270241aaL, 0xbe0b1010L,
6352  0xc90c2086L, 0x5768b525L, 0x206f85b3L, 0xb966d409L, 0xce61e49fL,
6353  0x5edef90eL, 0x29d9c998L, 0xb0d09822L, 0xc7d7a8b4L, 0x59b33d17L,
6354  0x2eb40d81L, 0xb7bd5c3bL, 0xc0ba6cadL, 0xedb88320L, 0x9abfb3b6L,
6355  0x03b6e20cL, 0x74b1d29aL, 0xead54739L, 0x9dd277afL, 0x04db2615L,
6356  0x73dc1683L, 0xe3630b12L, 0x94643b84L, 0x0d6d6a3eL, 0x7a6a5aa8L,
6357  0xe40ecf0bL, 0x9309ff9dL, 0x0a00ae27L, 0x7d079eb1L, 0xf00f9344L,
6358  0x8708a3d2L, 0x1e01f268L, 0x6906c2feL, 0xf762575dL, 0x806567cbL,
6359  0x196c3671L, 0x6e6b06e7L, 0xfed41b76L, 0x89d32be0L, 0x10da7a5aL,
6360  0x67dd4accL, 0xf9b9df6fL, 0x8ebeeff9L, 0x17b7be43L, 0x60b08ed5L,
6361  0xd6d6a3e8L, 0xa1d1937eL, 0x38d8c2c4L, 0x4fdff252L, 0xd1bb67f1L,
6362  0xa6bc5767L, 0x3fb506ddL, 0x48b2364bL, 0xd80d2bdaL, 0xaf0a1b4cL,
6363  0x36034af6L, 0x41047a60L, 0xdf60efc3L, 0xa867df55L, 0x316e8eefL,
6364  0x4669be79L, 0xcb61b38cL, 0xbc66831aL, 0x256fd2a0L, 0x5268e236L,
6365  0xcc0c7795L, 0xbb0b4703L, 0x220216b9L, 0x5505262fL, 0xc5ba3bbeL,
6366  0xb2bd0b28L, 0x2bb45a92L, 0x5cb36a04L, 0xc2d7ffa7L, 0xb5d0cf31L,
6367  0x2cd99e8bL, 0x5bdeae1dL, 0x9b64c2b0L, 0xec63f226L, 0x756aa39cL,
6368  0x026d930aL, 0x9c0906a9L, 0xeb0e363fL, 0x72076785L, 0x05005713L,
6369  0x95bf4a82L, 0xe2b87a14L, 0x7bb12baeL, 0x0cb61b38L, 0x92d28e9bL,
6370  0xe5d5be0dL, 0x7cdcefb7L, 0x0bdbdf21L, 0x86d3d2d4L, 0xf1d4e242L,
6371  0x68ddb3f8L, 0x1fda836eL, 0x81be16cdL, 0xf6b9265bL, 0x6fb077e1L,
6372  0x18b74777L, 0x88085ae6L, 0xff0f6a70L, 0x66063bcaL, 0x11010b5cL,
6373  0x8f659effL, 0xf862ae69L, 0x616bffd3L, 0x166ccf45L, 0xa00ae278L,
6374  0xd70dd2eeL, 0x4e048354L, 0x3903b3c2L, 0xa7672661L, 0xd06016f7L,
6375  0x4969474dL, 0x3e6e77dbL, 0xaed16a4aL, 0xd9d65adcL, 0x40df0b66L,
6376  0x37d83bf0L, 0xa9bcae53L, 0xdebb9ec5L, 0x47b2cf7fL, 0x30b5ffe9L,
6377  0xbdbdf21cL, 0xcabac28aL, 0x53b39330L, 0x24b4a3a6L, 0xbad03605L,
6378  0xcdd70693L, 0x54de5729L, 0x23d967bfL, 0xb3667a2eL, 0xc4614ab8L,
6379  0x5d681b02L, 0x2a6f2b94L, 0xb40bbe37L, 0xc30c8ea1L, 0x5a05df1bL,
6380  0x2d02ef8dL
6381  };
6382 
6383 #define CRC32(c, b) (crc_table[((int)(c) ^ (b)) & 0xff] ^ ((c) >> 8))
6384 #endif
6385 #define DO1(buf) crc = CRC32(crc, *buf++)
6386 #define DO2(buf) DO1(buf); DO1(buf)
6387 #define DO4(buf) DO2(buf); DO2(buf)
6388 #define DO8(buf) DO4(buf); DO4(buf)
6389 
6390  inline ulg crc32(ulg crc, const uch *buf, extent len) {
6391  if (buf == NULL) return 0L;
6392  crc = crc ^ 0xffffffffL;
6393  while (len >= 8) {
6394  DO8(buf); len -= 8;
6395  }
6396  if (len) do {
6397  DO1(buf);
6398  } while (--len);
6399  return crc ^ 0xffffffffL; // (instead of ~c for 64-bit machines)
6400  }
6401 
6402 
6403  inline void update_keys(unsigned long *keys, char c) {
6404  keys[0] = CRC32(keys[0], c);
6405  keys[1] += keys[0] & 0xFF;
6406  keys[1] = keys[1] * 134775813L + 1;
6407  keys[2] = CRC32(keys[2], keys[1] >> 24);
6408  }
6409  inline char decrypt_byte(unsigned long *keys) {
6410  unsigned temp = ((unsigned)keys[2] & 0xffff) | 2;
6411  return (char)(((temp * (temp ^ 1)) >> 8) & 0xff);
6412  }
6413  inline char zencode(unsigned long *keys, char c) {
6414  int t = decrypt_byte(keys);
6415  update_keys(keys, c);
6416  return (char)(t^c);
6417  }
6418 
6419 
6420 
6421 
6422 
6423 
6424 
6425  inline int lustricmp(const TCHAR *sa, const TCHAR *sb) {
6426  for (const TCHAR *ca = sa, *cb = sb; ; ca++, cb++) {
6427  int ia = tolower(*ca), ib = tolower(*cb);
6428  if (ia == ib && ia == 0) return 0;
6429  if (ia == ib) continue;
6430  if (ia < ib) return -1;
6431  if (ia > ib) return 1;
6432  }
6433  }
6434 
6435 
6436  inline bool HasZipSuffix(const TCHAR *fn) {
6437  const TCHAR *ext = fn + _tcslen(fn);
6438  while (ext > fn && *ext != '.') ext--;
6439  if (ext == fn && *ext != '.') return false;
6440  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".Z")) == 0) return true;
6441  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".zip")) == 0) return true;
6442  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".zoo")) == 0) return true;
6443  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".arc")) == 0) return true;
6444  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".lzh")) == 0) return true;
6445  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".arj")) == 0) return true;
6446  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".gz")) == 0) return true;
6447  if (lustricmp(ext, _T(".tgz")) == 0) return true;
6448  return false;
6449  }
6450 
6451 
6452 
6453 
6454 
6455 
6456 
6457 
6458  class TZip {
6459  public:
6460  TZip(const char *pwd) : hfout(0), mustclosehfout(false), hmapout(0), zfis(0), obuf(0), hfin(0), writ(0), oerr(false), hasputcen(false), ooffset(0), encwriting(false), encbuf(0), password(0), state(0) {
6461  if (pwd != 0 && *pwd != 0) {
6462  password = new char[strlen(pwd) + 1]; strcpy_s(password, strlen(pwd) + 1, pwd);
6463  }
6464  }
6465  ~TZip() {
6466  if (state != 0) delete state; state = 0; if (encbuf != 0) delete[] encbuf; encbuf = 0; if (password != 0) delete[] password; password = 0;
6467  }
6468 
6469  // These variables say about the file we're writing into
6470  // We can write to pipe, file-by-handle, file-by-name, memory-to-memmapfile
6471  char *password; // keep a copy of the password
6472  HANDLE hfout; // if valid, we'll write here (for files or pipes)
6473  bool mustclosehfout; // if true, we are responsible for closing hfout
6474  HANDLE hmapout; // otherwise, we'll write here (for memmap)
6475  unsigned ooffset; // for hfout, this is where the pointer was initially
6476  ZRESULT oerr; // did a write operation give rise to an error?
6477  unsigned writ; // how far have we written. This is maintained by Add, not write(), to avoid confusion over seeks
6478  bool ocanseek; // can we seek?
6479  char *obuf; // this is where we've locked mmap to view.
6480  unsigned int opos; // current pos in the mmap
6481  unsigned int mapsize; // the size of the map we created
6482  bool hasputcen; // have we yet placed the central directory?
6483  bool encwriting; // if true, then we'll encrypt stuff using 'keys' before we write it to disk
6484  unsigned long keys[3]; // keys are initialised inside Add()
6485  char *encbuf; // if encrypting, then this is a temporary workspace for encrypting the data
6486  unsigned int encbufsize; // (to be used and resized inside write(), and deleted in the destructor)
6487  //
6488  TZipFileInfo *zfis; // each file gets added onto this list, for writing the table at the end
6489  TState *state; // we use just one state object per zip, because it's big (500k)
6490 
6491  inline ZRESULT Create(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags);
6492  inline static unsigned sflush(void *param, const char *buf, unsigned *size);
6493  inline static unsigned swrite(void *param, const char *buf, unsigned size);
6494  inline unsigned int write(const char *buf, unsigned int size);
6495  inline bool oseek(unsigned int pos);
6496  inline ZRESULT GetMemory(void **pbuf, unsigned long *plen);
6497  inline ZRESULT Close();
6498 
6499  // some variables to do with the file currently being read:
6500  // I haven't done it object-orientedly here, just put them all
6501  // together, since OO didn't seem to make the design any clearer.
6502  ulg attr; iztimes times; ulg timestamp; // all open_* methods set these
6503  bool iseekable; long isize, ired; // size is not set until close() on pips
6504  ulg crc; // crc is not set until close(). iwrit is cumulative
6505  HANDLE hfin; bool selfclosehf; // for input files and pipes
6506  const char *bufin; unsigned int lenin, posin; // for memory
6507  // and a variable for what we've done with the input: (i.e. compressed it!)
6508  ulg csize; // compressed size, set by the compression routines
6509  // and this is used by some of the compression routines
6510  char buf[16384];
6511 
6512 
6513  inline ZRESULT open_file(const TCHAR *fn);
6514  inline ZRESULT open_handle(HANDLE hf, unsigned int len);
6515  inline ZRESULT open_mem(void *src, unsigned int len);
6516  inline ZRESULT open_dir();
6517  inline static unsigned sread(TState &s, char *buf, unsigned size);
6518  inline unsigned read(char *buf, unsigned size);
6519  inline ZRESULT iclose();
6520 
6521  inline ZRESULT ideflate(TZipFileInfo *zfi);
6522  inline ZRESULT istore();
6523 
6524  inline ZRESULT Add(const TCHAR *odstzn, void *src, unsigned int len, DWORD flags);
6525  inline ZRESULT AddCentral();
6526 
6527  };
6528 
6529 
6530 
6531  inline ZRESULT TZip::Create(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags) {
6532  if (hfout != 0 || hmapout != 0 || obuf != 0 || writ != 0 || oerr != ZR_OK || hasputcen) return ZR_NOTINITED;
6533  //
6534  if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE) {
6535  HANDLE hf = (HANDLE)z;
6536  hfout = hf; mustclosehfout = false;
6537 #ifdef DuplicateHandle
6538  BOOL res = DuplicateHandle(GetCurrentProcess(), hf, GetCurrentProcess(), &hfout, 0, FALSE, DUPLICATE_SAME_ACCESS);
6539  if (res) mustclosehandle = true;
6540 #endif
6541  // now we have hfout. Either we duplicated the handle and we close it ourselves
6542  // (while the caller closes h themselves), or we couldn't duplicate it.
6543  DWORD res = GetFilePosZ(hfout);
6544  ocanseek = (res != 0xFFFFFFFF);
6545  ooffset = ocanseek ? res : 0;
6546  return ZR_OK;
6547  } else if (flags == ZIP_FILENAME) {
6548  const TCHAR *fn = (const TCHAR*)z;
6549 
6550  hfout = CreateFile(fn, GENERIC_WRITE, 0, NULL, CREATE_ALWAYS, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, NULL);
6551  if (hfout == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
6552  hfout = 0; return ZR_NOFILE;
6553  }
6554 
6555  ocanseek = true;
6556  ooffset = 0;
6557  mustclosehfout = true;
6558  return ZR_OK;
6559  } else if (flags == ZIP_MEMORY) {
6560  unsigned int size = len;
6561  if (size == 0) return ZR_MEMSIZE;
6562 
6563  if (z != 0) obuf = (char*)z;
6564  else {
6565  hmapout = CreateFileMapping(INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE, NULL, PAGE_READWRITE, 0, size, NULL);
6566  if (hmapout == NULL) return ZR_NOALLOC;
6567  obuf = (char*)MapViewOfFile(hmapout, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, size);
6568  if (obuf == 0) {
6569  CloseHandle(hmapout); hmapout = 0; return ZR_NOALLOC;
6570  }
6571  }
6572 
6573  ocanseek = true;
6574  opos = 0; mapsize = size;
6575  return ZR_OK;
6576  } else return ZR_ARGS;
6577  }
6578 
6579  inline unsigned TZip::sflush(void *param, const char *buf, unsigned *size) { // static
6580  if (*size == 0) return 0;
6581  TZip *zip = (TZip*)param;
6582  unsigned int writ = zip->write(buf, *size);
6583  if (writ != 0) *size = 0;
6584  return writ;
6585  }
6586  inline unsigned TZip::swrite(void *param, const char *buf, unsigned size) { // static
6587  if (size == 0) return 0;
6588  TZip *zip = (TZip*)param; return zip->write(buf, size);
6589  }
6590  inline unsigned int TZip::write(const char *buf, unsigned int size) {
6591  const char *srcbuf = buf;
6592  if (encwriting) {
6593  if (encbuf != 0 && encbufsize < size) {
6594  delete[] encbuf; encbuf = 0;
6595  }
6596  if (encbuf == 0) {
6597  encbuf = new char[size * 2]; encbufsize = size;
6598  }
6599  memcpy(encbuf, buf, size);
6600  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < size; i++) encbuf[i] = zencode(keys, encbuf[i]);
6601  srcbuf = encbuf;
6602  }
6603  if (obuf != 0) {
6604  if (opos + size >= mapsize) {
6605  oerr = ZR_MEMSIZE; return 0;
6606  }
6607  memcpy(obuf + opos, srcbuf, size);
6608  opos += size;
6609  return size;
6610  } else if (hfout != 0) {
6611 
6612  DWORD writ; WriteFile(hfout, srcbuf, size, &writ, NULL);
6613  return writ;
6614  }
6615  oerr = ZR_NOTINITED; return 0;
6616  }
6617 
6618  inline bool TZip::oseek(unsigned int pos) {
6619  if (!ocanseek) {
6620  oerr = ZR_SEEK; return false;
6621  }
6622  if (obuf != 0) {
6623  if (pos >= mapsize) {
6624  oerr = ZR_MEMSIZE; return false;
6625  }
6626  opos = pos;
6627  return true;
6628  } else if (hfout != 0) {
6629 
6630  SetFilePointer(hfout, pos + ooffset, NULL, FILE_BEGIN);
6631  return true;
6632  }
6633  oerr = ZR_NOTINITED; return 0;
6634  }
6635 
6636  inline ZRESULT TZip::GetMemory(void **pbuf, unsigned long *plen) { // When the user calls GetMemory, they're presumably at the end
6637  // of all their adding. In any case, we have to add the central
6638  // directory now, otherwise the memory we tell them won't be complete.
6639  if (!hasputcen) AddCentral(); hasputcen = true;
6640  if (pbuf != NULL) *pbuf = (void*)obuf;
6641  if (plen != NULL) *plen = writ;
6642  if (obuf == NULL) return ZR_NOTMMAP;
6643  return ZR_OK;
6644  }
6645 
6646  inline ZRESULT TZip::Close() { // if the directory hadn't already been added through a call to GetMemory,
6647  // then we do it now
6648  ZRESULT res = ZR_OK; if (!hasputcen) res = AddCentral(); hasputcen = true;
6649 
6650  if (obuf != 0 && hmapout != 0) UnmapViewOfFile(obuf); obuf = 0;
6651  if (hmapout != 0) CloseHandle(hmapout); hmapout = 0;
6652  if (hfout != 0 && mustclosehfout) CloseHandle(hfout); hfout = 0; mustclosehfout = false;
6653 
6654  return res;
6655  }
6656 
6657 
6658 
6659 
6660  inline ZRESULT TZip::open_file(const TCHAR *fn) {
6661  hfin = 0; bufin = 0; selfclosehf = false; crc = CRCVAL_INITIAL; isize = 0; csize = 0; ired = 0;
6662  if (fn == 0) return ZR_ARGS;
6663 
6664  HANDLE hf = CreateFile(fn, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
6665  if (hf == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return ZR_NOFILE;
6666  ZRESULT res = open_handle(hf, 0);
6667  if (res != ZR_OK) {
6668  CloseHandle(hf); return res;
6669  }
6670 
6671  selfclosehf = true;
6672  return ZR_OK;
6673  }
6674  inline ZRESULT TZip::open_handle(HANDLE hf, unsigned int len) {
6675  hfin = 0; bufin = 0; selfclosehf = false; crc = CRCVAL_INITIAL; isize = 0; csize = 0; ired = 0;
6676  if (hf == 0 || hf == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return ZR_ARGS;
6677  bool canseek;
6678 
6679  DWORD res = SetFilePointer(hfout, 0, 0, FILE_CURRENT);
6680  canseek = (res != 0xFFFFFFFF);
6681 
6682  if (canseek) {
6683  ZRESULT res = GetFileInfo(hf, &attr, &isize, &times, &timestamp);
6684  if (res != ZR_OK) return res;
6685 
6686  SetFilePointer(hf, 0, NULL, FILE_BEGIN); // because GetFileInfo will have screwed it up
6687  iseekable = true; hfin = hf;
6688  return ZR_OK;
6689  } else {
6690  attr = 0x80000000; // just a normal file
6691  isize = -1; // can't know size until at the end
6692  if (len != 0) isize = len; // unless we were told explicitly!
6693  iseekable = false;
6694  WORD dosdate, dostime; GetNow(&times.atime, &dosdate, &dostime);
6695  times.mtime = times.atime;
6696  times.ctime = times.atime;
6697  timestamp = (WORD)dostime | (((DWORD)dosdate) << 16);
6698  hfin = hf;
6699  return ZR_OK;
6700  }
6701  }
6702  inline ZRESULT TZip::open_mem(void *src, unsigned int len) {
6703  hfin = 0; bufin = (const char*)src; selfclosehf = false; crc = CRCVAL_INITIAL; ired = 0; csize = 0; ired = 0;
6704  lenin = len; posin = 0;
6705  if (src == 0 || len == 0) return ZR_ARGS;
6706  attr = 0x80000000; // just a normal file
6707  isize = len;
6708  iseekable = true;
6709  WORD dosdate, dostime; GetNow(&times.atime, &dosdate, &dostime);
6710  times.mtime = times.atime;
6711  times.ctime = times.atime;
6712  timestamp = (WORD)dostime | (((DWORD)dosdate) << 16);
6713  return ZR_OK;
6714  }
6715  inline ZRESULT TZip::open_dir() {
6716  hfin = 0; bufin = 0; selfclosehf = false; crc = CRCVAL_INITIAL; isize = 0; csize = 0; ired = 0;
6717  attr = 0x41C00010; // a readable writable directory, and again directory
6718  isize = 0;
6719  iseekable = false;
6720  WORD dosdate, dostime; GetNow(&times.atime, &dosdate, &dostime);
6721  times.mtime = times.atime;
6722  times.ctime = times.atime;
6723  timestamp = (WORD)dostime | (((DWORD)dosdate) << 16);
6724  return ZR_OK;
6725  }
6726 
6727  inline unsigned TZip::sread(TState &s, char *buf, unsigned size) { // static
6728  TZip *zip = (TZip*)s.param;
6729  return zip->read(buf, size);
6730  }
6731 
6732  inline unsigned TZip::read(char *buf, unsigned size) {
6733  if (bufin != 0) {
6734  if (posin >= lenin) return 0; // end of input
6735  ulg red = lenin - posin;
6736  if (red > size) red = size;
6737  memcpy(buf, bufin + posin, red);
6738  posin += red;
6739  ired += red;
6740  crc = crc32(crc, (uch*)buf, red);
6741  return red;
6742  } else if (hfin != 0) {
6743  DWORD red;
6744 
6745  BOOL ok = ReadFile(hfin, buf, size, &red, NULL);
6746  if (!ok) return 0;
6747 
6748  ired += red;
6749  crc = crc32(crc, (uch*)buf, red);
6750  return red;
6751  } else {
6752  oerr = ZR_NOTINITED; return 0;
6753  }
6754  }
6755 
6756  inline ZRESULT TZip::iclose() {
6757 
6758  if (selfclosehf && hfin != 0) CloseHandle(hfin); hfin = 0;
6759 
6760  bool mismatch = (isize != -1 && isize != ired);
6761  isize = ired; // and crc has been being updated anyway
6762  if (mismatch) return ZR_MISSIZE;
6763  else return ZR_OK;
6764  }
6765 
6766 
6767 
6768  inline ZRESULT TZip::ideflate(TZipFileInfo *zfi) {
6769  if (state == 0) state = new TState();
6770  // It's a very big object! 500k! We allocate it on the heap, because PocketPC's
6771  // stack breaks if we try to put it all on the stack. It will be deleted lazily
6772  state->err = 0;
6773  state->readfunc = sread; state->flush_outbuf = sflush;
6774  state->param = this; state->level = 8; state->seekable = iseekable; state->err = NULL;
6775  // the following line will make ct_init realise it has to perform the init
6776  state->ts.static_dtree[0].dl.len = 0;
6777  // Thanks to Alvin77 for this crucial fix:
6778  state->ds.window_size = 0;
6779  // I think that covers everything that needs to be initted.
6780  //
6781  bi_init(*state, buf, sizeof(buf), 1); // it used to be just 1024-size, not 16384 as here
6782  ct_init(*state, &zfi->att);
6783  lm_init(*state, state->level, &zfi->flg);
6784  ulg sz = deflate(*state);
6785  csize = sz;
6786  ZRESULT r = ZR_OK; if (state->err != NULL) r = ZR_FLATE;
6787  return r;
6788  }
6789 
6790  inline ZRESULT TZip::istore() {
6791  ulg size = 0;
6792  for (;;) {
6793  unsigned int cin = read(buf, 16384); if (cin <= 0 || cin == (unsigned int)EOF) break;
6794  unsigned int cout = write(buf, cin); if (cout != cin) return ZR_MISSIZE;
6795  size += cin;
6796  }
6797  csize = size;
6798  return ZR_OK;
6799  }
6800 
6801 
6802 
6803 
6804 
6805  __declspec(selectany) bool has_seeded = false;
6806  inline ZRESULT TZip::Add(const TCHAR *odstzn, void *src, unsigned int len, DWORD flags) {
6807  if (oerr) return ZR_FAILED;
6808  if (hasputcen) return ZR_ENDED;
6809 
6810  // if we use password encryption, then every isize and csize is 12 bytes bigger
6811  int passex = 0; if (password != 0 && flags != ZIP_FOLDER) passex = 12;
6812 
6813  // zip has its own notion of what its names should look like: i.e. dir/file.stuff
6814  TCHAR dstzn[MAX_PATH]; _tcsncpy_s(dstzn, MAX_PATH, odstzn, MAX_PATH); dstzn[MAX_PATH - 1] = 0;
6815  if (*dstzn == 0) return ZR_ARGS;
6816  TCHAR *d = dstzn; while (*d != 0) {
6817  if (*d == '\\') *d = '/'; d++;
6818  }
6819  bool isdir = (flags == ZIP_FOLDER);
6820  bool needs_trailing_slash = (isdir && dstzn[_tcslen(dstzn) - 1] != '/');
6821  int method = DEFLATE; if (isdir || HasZipSuffix(dstzn)) method = STORE;
6822 
6823  // now open whatever was our input source:
6824  ZRESULT openres;
6825  if (flags == ZIP_FILENAME) openres = open_file((const TCHAR*)src);
6826  else if (flags == ZIP_HANDLE) openres = open_handle((HANDLE)src, len);
6827  else if (flags == ZIP_MEMORY) openres = open_mem(src, len);
6828  else if (flags == ZIP_FOLDER) openres = open_dir();
6829  else return ZR_ARGS;
6830  if (openres != ZR_OK) return openres;
6831 
6832  // A zip "entry" consists of a local header (which includes the file name),
6833  // then the compressed data, and possibly an extended local header.
6834 
6835  // Initialize the local header
6836  TZipFileInfo zfi; zfi.nxt = NULL;
6837  strcpy_s(zfi.name, 260, "");
6838 #ifdef UNICODE
6839  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, dstzn, -1, zfi.iname, MAX_PATH, 0, 0);
6840 #else
6841  strncpy(zfi.iname, dstzn, MAX_PATH); zfi.iname[MAX_PATH - 1] = 0;
6842 #endif
6843  zfi.nam = strlen(zfi.iname);
6844  if (needs_trailing_slash) {
6845  strcat_s(zfi.iname, "/"); zfi.nam++;
6846  }
6847  strcpy_s(zfi.zname, 260, "");
6848  zfi.extra = NULL; zfi.ext = 0; // extra header to go after this compressed data, and its length
6849  zfi.cextra = NULL; zfi.cext = 0; // extra header to go in the central end-of-zip directory, and its length
6850  zfi.comment = NULL; zfi.com = 0; // comment, and its length
6851  zfi.mark = 1;
6852  zfi.dosflag = 0;
6853  zfi.att = (ush)BINARY;
6854  zfi.vem = (ush)0xB17; // 0xB00 is win32 os-code. 0x17 is 23 in decimal: zip 2.3
6855  zfi.ver = (ush)20; // Needs PKUNZIP 2.0 to unzip it
6856  zfi.tim = timestamp;
6857  // Even though we write the header now, it will have to be rewritten, since we don't know compressed size or crc.
6858  zfi.crc = 0; // to be updated later
6859  zfi.flg = 8; // 8 means 'there is an extra header'. Assume for the moment that we need it.
6860  if (password != 0 && !isdir) zfi.flg = 9; // and 1 means 'password-encrypted'
6861  zfi.lflg = zfi.flg; // to be updated later
6862  zfi.how = (ush)method; // to be updated later
6863  zfi.siz = (ulg)(method == STORE && isize >= 0 ? isize + passex : 0); // to be updated later
6864  zfi.len = (ulg)(isize); // to be updated later
6865  zfi.dsk = 0;
6866  zfi.atx = attr;
6867  zfi.off = writ + ooffset; // offset within file of the start of this local record
6868  // stuff the 'times' structure into zfi.extra
6869 
6870  // nb. apparently there's a problem with PocketPC CE(zip)->CE(unzip) fails. And removing the following block fixes it up.
6871  char xloc[EB_L_UT_SIZE]; zfi.extra = xloc; zfi.ext = EB_L_UT_SIZE;
6872  char xcen[EB_C_UT_SIZE]; zfi.cextra = xcen; zfi.cext = EB_C_UT_SIZE;
6873  xloc[0] = 'U';
6874  xloc[1] = 'T';
6875  xloc[2] = EB_UT_LEN(3); // length of data part of e.f.
6876  xloc[3] = 0;
6877  xloc[4] = EB_UT_FL_MTIME | EB_UT_FL_ATIME | EB_UT_FL_CTIME;
6878  xloc[5] = (char)(times.mtime);
6879  xloc[6] = (char)(times.mtime >> 8);
6880  xloc[7] = (char)(times.mtime >> 16);
6881  xloc[8] = (char)(times.mtime >> 24);
6882  xloc[9] = (char)(times.atime);
6883  xloc[10] = (char)(times.atime >> 8);
6884  xloc[11] = (char)(times.atime >> 16);
6885  xloc[12] = (char)(times.atime >> 24);
6886  xloc[13] = (char)(times.ctime);
6887  xloc[14] = (char)(times.ctime >> 8);
6888  xloc[15] = (char)(times.ctime >> 16);
6889  xloc[16] = (char)(times.ctime >> 24);
6890  memcpy(zfi.cextra, zfi.extra, EB_C_UT_SIZE);
6891  zfi.cextra[EB_LEN] = EB_UT_LEN(1);
6892 
6893 
6894  // (1) Start by writing the local header:
6895  int r = putlocal(&zfi, swrite, this);
6896  if (r != ZE_OK) {
6897  iclose(); return ZR_WRITE;
6898  }
6899  writ += 4 + LOCHEAD + (unsigned int)zfi.nam + (unsigned int)zfi.ext;
6900  if (oerr != ZR_OK) {
6901  iclose(); return oerr;
6902  }
6903 
6904  // (1.5) if necessary, write the encryption header
6905  keys[0] = 305419896L;
6906  keys[1] = 591751049L;
6907  keys[2] = 878082192L;
6908  for (const char *cp = password; cp != 0 && *cp != 0; cp++) update_keys(keys, *cp);
6909  // generate some random bytes
6910 
6911  DWORD a = (size_t)GetDesktopWindow()&INT_MAX;
6912  if (!has_seeded) srand(GetTickCount() ^ a);
6913 
6914  char encbuf[12]; for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) encbuf[i] = (char)((rand() >> 7) & 0xff);
6915  encbuf[11] = (char)((zfi.tim >> 8) & 0xff);
6916  for (int ei = 0; ei < 12; ei++) encbuf[ei] = zencode(keys, encbuf[ei]);
6917  if (password != 0 && !isdir) {
6918  swrite(this, encbuf, 12); writ += 12;
6919  }
6920 
6921  //(2) Write deflated/stored file to zip file
6922  ZRESULT writeres = ZR_OK;
6923  encwriting = (password != 0 && !isdir); // an object member variable to say whether we write to disk encrypted
6924  if (!isdir && method == DEFLATE) writeres = ideflate(&zfi);
6925  else if (!isdir && method == STORE) writeres = istore();
6926  else if (isdir) csize = 0;
6927  encwriting = false;
6928  iclose();
6929  writ += csize;
6930  if (oerr != ZR_OK) return oerr;
6931  if (writeres != ZR_OK) return ZR_WRITE;
6932 
6933  // (3) Either rewrite the local header with correct information...
6934  bool first_header_has_size_right = (zfi.siz == csize + passex);
6935  zfi.crc = crc;
6936  zfi.siz = csize + passex;
6937  zfi.len = isize;
6938  if (ocanseek && (password == 0 || isdir)) {
6939  zfi.how = (ush)method;
6940  if ((zfi.flg & 1) == 0) zfi.flg &= ~8; // clear the extended local header flag
6941  zfi.lflg = zfi.flg;
6942  // rewrite the local header:
6943  if (!oseek(zfi.off - ooffset)) return ZR_SEEK;
6944  if ((r = putlocal(&zfi, swrite, this)) != ZE_OK) return ZR_WRITE;
6945  if (!oseek(writ)) return ZR_SEEK;
6946  } else { // (4) ... or put an updated header at the end
6947  if (zfi.how != (ush)method) return ZR_NOCHANGE;
6948  if (method == STORE && !first_header_has_size_right) return ZR_NOCHANGE;
6949  if ((r = putextended(&zfi, swrite, this)) != ZE_OK) return ZR_WRITE;
6950  writ += 16L;
6951  zfi.flg = zfi.lflg; // if flg modified by inflate, for the central index
6952  }
6953  if (oerr != ZR_OK) return oerr;
6954 
6955  // Keep a copy of the zipfileinfo, for our end-of-zip directory
6956  char *cextra = new char[zfi.cext]; memcpy(cextra, zfi.cextra, zfi.cext); zfi.cextra = cextra;
6957  TZipFileInfo *pzfi = new TZipFileInfo; memcpy(pzfi, &zfi, sizeof(zfi));
6958  if (zfis == NULL) zfis = pzfi;
6959  else {
6960  TZipFileInfo *z = zfis; while (z->nxt != NULL) z = z->nxt; z->nxt = pzfi;
6961  }
6962  return ZR_OK;
6963  }
6964 
6965  inline ZRESULT TZip::AddCentral() { // write central directory
6966  int numentries = 0;
6967  ulg pos_at_start_of_central = writ;
6968  //ulg tot_unc_size=0, tot_compressed_size=0;
6969  bool okay = true;
6970  for (TZipFileInfo *zfi = zfis; zfi != NULL; ) {
6971  if (okay) {
6972  int res = putcentral(zfi, swrite, this);
6973  if (res != ZE_OK) okay = false;
6974  }
6975  writ += 4 + CENHEAD + (unsigned int)zfi->nam + (unsigned int)zfi->cext + (unsigned int)zfi->com;
6976  //tot_unc_size += zfi->len;
6977  //tot_compressed_size += zfi->siz;
6978  numentries++;
6979  //
6980  TZipFileInfo *zfinext = zfi->nxt;
6981  if (zfi->cextra != 0) delete[] zfi->cextra;
6982  delete zfi;
6983  zfi = zfinext;
6984  }
6985  ulg center_size = writ - pos_at_start_of_central;
6986  if (okay) {
6987  int res = putend(numentries, center_size, pos_at_start_of_central + ooffset, 0, NULL, swrite, this);
6988  if (res != ZE_OK) okay = false;
6989  writ += 4 + ENDHEAD + 0;
6990  }
6991  if (!okay) return ZR_WRITE;
6992  return ZR_OK;
6993  }
6994 
6995 
6996 
6997 
6998 
6999  __declspec(selectany)ZRESULT lasterrorZ = ZR_OK;
7000 
7001  inline unsigned int FormatZipMessageZ(ZRESULT code, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
7002  if (code == ZR_RECENT) code = lasterrorZ;
7003  const char *msg = "unknown zip result code";
7004  switch (code) {
7005  case ZR_OK: msg = "Success"; break;
7006  case ZR_NODUPH: msg = "Culdn't duplicate handle"; break;
7007  case ZR_NOFILE: msg = "Couldn't create/open file"; break;
7008  case ZR_NOALLOC: msg = "Failed to allocate memory"; break;
7009  case ZR_WRITE: msg = "Error writing to file"; break;
7010  case ZR_NOTFOUND: msg = "File not found in the zipfile"; break;
7011  case ZR_MORE: msg = "Still more data to unzip"; break;
7012  case ZR_CORRUPT: msg = "Zipfile is corrupt or not a zipfile"; break;
7013  case ZR_READ: msg = "Error reading file"; break;
7014  case ZR_ARGS: msg = "Caller: faulty arguments"; break;
7015  case ZR_PARTIALUNZ: msg = "Caller: the file had already been partially unzipped"; break;
7016  case ZR_NOTMMAP: msg = "Caller: can only get memory of a memory zipfile"; break;
7017  case ZR_MEMSIZE: msg = "Caller: not enough space allocated for memory zipfile"; break;
7018  case ZR_FAILED: msg = "Caller: there was a previous error"; break;
7019  case ZR_ENDED: msg = "Caller: additions to the zip have already been ended"; break;
7020  case ZR_ZMODE: msg = "Caller: mixing creation and opening of zip"; break;
7021  case ZR_NOTINITED: msg = "Zip-bug: internal initialisation not completed"; break;
7022  case ZR_SEEK: msg = "Zip-bug: trying to seek the unseekable"; break;
7023  case ZR_MISSIZE: msg = "Zip-bug: the anticipated size turned out wrong"; break;
7024  case ZR_NOCHANGE: msg = "Zip-bug: tried to change mind, but not allowed"; break;
7025  case ZR_FLATE: msg = "Zip-bug: an internal error during flation"; break;
7026  }
7027  unsigned int mlen = (unsigned int)strlen(msg);
7028  if (buf == 0 || len == 0) return mlen;
7029  unsigned int n = mlen; if (n + 1 > len) n = len - 1;
7030  //strncpy(buf,msg,n);
7031  memcpy(buf, msg, n);
7032  buf[n] = 0;
7033  return mlen;
7034  }
7035 
7036 
7037 
7038  typedef struct {
7039  DWORD flag;
7040  TZip *zip;
7041  } TZipHandleData;
7042 
7043 
7044  inline HZIP CreateZipInternal(void *z, unsigned int len, DWORD flags, const char *password) {
7045  TZip *zip = new TZip(password);
7046  lasterrorZ = zip->Create(z, len, flags);
7047  if (lasterrorZ != ZR_OK) {
7048  delete zip; return 0;
7049  }
7050  TZipHandleData *han = new TZipHandleData;
7051  han->flag = 2; han->zip = zip; return (HZIP)han;
7052  }
7053  inline HZIP CreateZipHandle(HANDLE h, const char *password) {
7054  return CreateZipInternal(h, 0, ZIP_HANDLE, password);
7055  }
7056  inline HZIP CreateZip(const TCHAR *fn, const char *password) {
7057  return CreateZipInternal((void*)fn, 0, ZIP_FILENAME, password);
7058  }
7059  inline HZIP CreateZip(void *z, unsigned int len, const char *password) {
7060  return CreateZipInternal(z, len, ZIP_MEMORY, password);
7061  }
7062 
7063 
7064  inline ZRESULT ZipAddInternal(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, void *src, unsigned int len, DWORD flags) {
7065  if (hz == 0) {
7066  lasterrorZ = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
7067  }
7068  TZipHandleData *han = (TZipHandleData*)hz;
7069  if (han->flag != 2) {
7070  lasterrorZ = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
7071  }
7072  TZip *zip = han->zip;
7073  lasterrorZ = zip->Add(dstzn, src, len, flags);
7074  return lasterrorZ;
7075  }
7076  inline ZRESULT ZipAdd(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, const TCHAR *fn) {
7077  return ZipAddInternal(hz, dstzn, (void*)fn, 0, ZIP_FILENAME);
7078  }
7079  inline ZRESULT ZipAdd(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, void *src, unsigned int len) {
7080  return ZipAddInternal(hz, dstzn, src, len, ZIP_MEMORY);
7081  }
7082  inline ZRESULT ZipAddHandle(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, HANDLE h) {
7083  return ZipAddInternal(hz, dstzn, h, 0, ZIP_HANDLE);
7084  }
7085  inline ZRESULT ZipAddHandle(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn, HANDLE h, unsigned int len) {
7086  return ZipAddInternal(hz, dstzn, h, len, ZIP_HANDLE);
7087  }
7088  inline ZRESULT ZipAddFolder(HZIP hz, const TCHAR *dstzn) {
7089  return ZipAddInternal(hz, dstzn, 0, 0, ZIP_FOLDER);
7090  }
7091 
7092 
7093 
7094  inline ZRESULT ZipGetMemory(HZIP hz, void **buf, unsigned long *len) {
7095  if (hz == 0) {
7096  if (buf != 0) *buf = 0; if (len != 0) *len = 0; lasterrorZ = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
7097  }
7098  TZipHandleData *han = (TZipHandleData*)hz;
7099  if (han->flag != 2) {
7100  lasterrorZ = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
7101  }
7102  TZip *zip = han->zip;
7103  lasterrorZ = zip->GetMemory(buf, len);
7104  return lasterrorZ;
7105  }
7106 
7107  inline ZRESULT CloseZipZ(HZIP hz) {
7108  if (hz == 0) {
7109  lasterrorZ = ZR_ARGS; return ZR_ARGS;
7110  }
7111  TZipHandleData *han = (TZipHandleData*)hz;
7112  if (han->flag != 2) {
7113  lasterrorZ = ZR_ZMODE; return ZR_ZMODE;
7114  }
7115  TZip *zip = han->zip;
7116  lasterrorZ = zip->Close();
7117  delete zip;
7118  delete han;
7119  return lasterrorZ;
7120  }
7121 
7122  inline bool IsZipHandleZ(HZIP hz) {
7123  if (hz == 0) return false;
7124  TZipHandleData *han = (TZipHandleData*)hz;
7125  return (han->flag == 2);
7126  }
7127 }
7128 #endif //_WIN32
7129 #endif //DOXYGEN
7130 #endif
String.h
문자열 처리 라이브러리
다음에 의해 생성됨 :   1.8.13
